samples.situation: Have an essay due Monday and haven’t even finished the lessons. I feel like I shouldn’t be doing this degree

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: what have you done so far? Do you have some of the assignment done?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: How did you get motivated? Do you have any advice?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I always thought of my GPA and how a single grade could affect all of my hard work. Perhaps thinking of what this grade can affect will motivate you to really avoid any stressful situations it may bring.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah to be fair this is a big part of my degree so I can’t not do it. I just find the subject so hard compared to some of the other ones I’ve done so far. It’s a lot of maths which I suck at

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I have been there, I major in Biotechnology engineering. Image what life will be like once you are finished with this nightmare assignment. Give it your all. Find that fire inside of you and push through. You are almost there, remember everything you have overcome, dont let this little hurdle set you back. I have faith in you!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Right now, dive into the subject, find outside resources. Hustle time. the great always struggle towards the end, you are one of those great! remind yourself of what you can do and have overcome.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Wow, biotech engineering must have been cool. Makes my economics module seem a bit silly now haha. I think I’m just getting frustrated with myself which is annoying in itself when I know deep down I probably could do it if I stopped trying to avoid it

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: oh no! my best friend has a business major and economics class almost killed her. she took it FOUR times before she passed it. She never gave up! this is your dream, chase it, own it, and conquer it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am the champion of getting frustrated. I take a breather and come back. Always come back. take a nap or do something you enjoy doing.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I’m glad I’m not the only one who struggles with economics although I definitely don’t want to have to retake it haha. I guess I will have to retake it if I don’t actually do the work though!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I think even just being here is procrastinating really when I should be writing my essay!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: My poor friend, economics in itself is a beast that only unique minds understand. But, I do believe that with effort and dedication. She will be so mad for telling someone else how many times she fail the class. You can do it! you are at the end!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: get to work and make it happen!

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, even though I’ve been feeling overwhelmed, I managed to write a rough outline for my essay. It’s not much, but it feels like a start.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That's a great step forward! Outlining can really help organize your thoughts and make writing easier. What part of the essay are you most excited to tackle?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I think I’m looking forward to the analysis part. It’s kind of like solving a puzzle, and I usually enjoy that. It's just getting there that's the challenge.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Absolutely, the analysis can be really rewarding once you get into it. Maybe you can set small goals to tackle one section at a time? That way, it won’t feel so daunting.

samples.situation: I'm mad at my boyfriend for not taking responsibility.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Responsibility in regards to what?  Like in what area of life do you mean?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: We've been dating 4 years, meeting in high school.  Now we're graduated and I've gone to college.  He doesn't have a job yet after 1 year.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Hmm, has he been looking for work, or just laying around playing video games and shit like that?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I've been away at college and just came home on break so I'm not sure.  He tells me he is looking but I don't know how it's taking a year to get a job.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Well, I suppose it's possible that he's been earnestly looking and just not having any luck.  Is he kind of a loser in general, or is he a stand-up guy?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: He got average grades in school but didn't really miss days from school.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Ok, so it sounds like you're kind of fed up with him in general, and not having a job is maybe just a part of the bigger issue?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That's probably correct.  He hasn't been in contact with me as much since I left for school.  I just expected more.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Well,  it sounds like you're both in kind of a transitional period in life.  It's pretty normal for relationships to not necessarily survive through things like this

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That's so sad since we have so many years together, but I feel like I'm moving forward and he is staying in place.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah, I mean it's never easy going through a breakup, but people change as they get older and mature, and they aren't necessarily going to still be compatible the whole time.   Also I think it's important to not think of a relationship that peters out as a failed one.   Just because it didn't last until one of you died doesn't mean it wasn't a success.   I think people put too much emphasis on permanence.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That's true, it can maybe just be a stepping stone to build other relationships.  Thanks for the wisdom.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Well I've got a couple decades on you, so I've been through this a few times before.   Actually I'm still friends with pretty much all of my exes.   I mean just because I'm not romantically involved with them anymore doesn't mean that they aren't still terrific people.   Hell, I hung out with two of them just today.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That's great you have maintained positive relationships and were also able to move  forward.  Thanks for the advice. I appreciate it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You bet.   So what do you think you'll do from here?   I mean do you know you want to move on for sure, or do you think you'll see if you can work through this patch?  I don't know that there's a wrong answer .

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Another thing about that situation is that I feel like if I break up with him, my life will be completely over.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds really tough. It's understandable to feel that way when you've invested so much time in a relationship.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Honestly, I think I can't live without him. If we end things, I don't see how I'll be able to move on.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Yes, that's how it is. It makes sense that you feel incapable of moving on given how deeply you've connected.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V4 violation because it reinforces the unrealistic belief expressed in Turn 3 that the seeker can't live without the boyfriend, accepting it as a fact without challenge.

samples.situation: Everything was going crazy in the world with COVID. I was worried about my daughter and her education. Then suddenly, I lose a lot of my hours at work and have to quit one of my jobs due to the virus and becoming her main caretaker again. This really makes me nervous because the price of everything is continually going up and I have little excess money to spend.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I understand. It is a scary time right now. Things will not always be this way though. We will get through it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: The important part right now is to stay safe and healthy for yourself and for your family.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: What kind of work did you do before the pandemic?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'd like to think this will be over sooner than later, but it's hard to really think about it. I was a merchandiser for retail stores.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I had been a stay at home parent before so our family was used to one income for a long time. It was nice to not always have to stress about money since I was working again. It seems the stress is a lot more now though because of everything going on in the country.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Yes our country is in a lot of uncertainty right now. And having a second income always helps. Have you considered possibly finding a work from home job? Perhaps look at what skills you've developed, and update your resume to reflect the skills you have that will transfer over to a work from home job.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'm always concerned about scams. There are so many untrustworthy places that I hate putting myself and my information out for others to get who aren't honest.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I understand. There are always companies or jobs out there that are scams. What I found worked best was looking at reputable sites like LinkedIn, GlassDoor, etc. Right now is a good time to find a work from home job from reputable companies. I've found that a lot of companies have transitioned over and developed jobs that can be done from home. I actually work from home myself.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Oh thats really encouraging. I will definitely look into that.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Another suggestion I can make is contacting your local workforce department  (department of unemployment) as they can make suggestions too.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I never thought about the unemployment office. I know so many people are worse off than me that I almost feel guilty to reach out. I really appreciateyour trips

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: tips

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You already have a lot of skills you didn't think about. As a stay at home parent, you are like the CEO of your own company. You manage day to day operations. You also do scheduling, finance management, etc.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've been thinking about how I can leverage my experience as a stay-at-home parent to find something that fits my skills.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That's a great idea! It sounds like you have many transferable skills from managing a household. What specific skills are you thinking of emphasizing?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I’m considering highlighting my time management and organization skills since they are crucial for both parenting and work.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Those are excellent skills to showcase! Perhaps you could also think about including any volunteer work you did or projects that involved planning and coordination. That could make your resume even stronger.

prefix_dialog.content:
Thats great! I judge you are worthy of the compliments :) Thanks for connecting with me today
!

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

samples.situation: I got fired from my job during the pandemic, I don't know if I'll be able to find another job.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It seems that Covid has had a negative effect on your employment and financial insecurity is weighing heavily on you.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes that is correct, and with the job market, how am I supposed to find a secured job.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I can understand that feeling of insecurity, and how helpless you feel. I myself have been in the position of loss of income and financial insecurity in the past, and while it was hard while I was in the valley, I was able to walk out of it with some valuable lessons.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That is true, I just have to work hard for myself. I am learning valuable lessons like the idea that companies don't care about their workers, etc. Working more on myself sounds like the better option.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It sounds like you are already identifying areas of self improvement. A person with confidence in themselves and the ability to reflect and grow are promising attributes potential employers look for.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you for all that you've done today, I couldn't get through it without you dude.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you for your time today, hearing my concerns about the future!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You are so welcome. I know that you will succeed in your employment search as you have the skills and humility that potential employers are looking for.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'll continue to keep on the lookout for new job opportunities, as well as improving myself for the long term. I appreciate it!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: As you continue your job search, can you think of ways that you could trim your cost of living for the short term? Returning to the basics for a time could help save you money while you take the next steps with your career. Things like planning meals ahead of time, using items you already have instead of buying new, letting go of subscriptions you don't use daily or don't deem necessary.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I could definitely reduce my spending like going out less for fast food, cutting my Netflix and Hulu subscriptions, and prepare my own meals for the next week weeks, as I try to find a new job. This would definitely help with my concerns about income and financial security.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Our lifestyle seems to be all about convenience and instant gratification, I myself being guilty of wanting those as well. But I think when we strip our needs down to the basics for a while we allow ourselves to find what is really necessary, as well as what is truly important to us.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Very true, people definitely need to find their fitting for when things go wrong. Failure or bad events give us time to think about the important things in life, as well as our true needs.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: And it is important to remember that everyone goes through cycles of feast or famine, and that when you are walking through a famine you yourself are not a failure. As long as you know you are doing your best to succeed under the circumstances you have been handed, you will never truly be a failure to yourself or to others.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, something else happened recently that I didn't mention. I overheard some people at work saying that they might be laying off more employees soon, but I'm not sure if it's true.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds concerning. Do you have any idea about how many more layoffs they might be considering or when that could happen?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I can't tell for sure. It's unclear if those rumors are just speculation or if there's some truth behind them.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Even without knowing all the details, it clearly shows that your current job situation is unstable, and it would be wise to start looking for new opportunities immediately.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V1 violation because it jumps to a conclusion about the seeker's job stability without asking for clarification, making a prescriptive suggestion based on incomplete information.

samples.situation: My friend has passed away and I'm struggling to deal with the grief.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It sounds like you're going through the normal grieving process and that time and talking about it can be of a huge help.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: thanks for that. it's good to know that this is normal and if it carries on I think I speak to somebody about this in more detail.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: All the best.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's completely understandable to miss the joy he brought to your life. Sharing those memories, like how he made you laugh, can be a beautiful way to keep his spirit alive.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Yes, I think sharing those memories could help. I just hope everyone feels comfortable doing that.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Creating a safe space for your friends to share their stories might help. You could gently encourage everyone to reflect on their favorite moments with him. It could be quite healing.

samples.situation: My new supervisor hates me.  She already hated me before she was my boss. In addition to being a terrible manager, she has made a personal goal to inhibit my ability to do my job.  She has taken from me all parts of my job that I value.  This upsets me personally and I am sad & angry that the rest of my team, who I care about, is no longer supported.  We have no recourse to solve this problem.

prefix_dialog.content: Not too bad outside of work.  I'm miserable there.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have you considered going over her head and putting in a complaint? Especially if she is making everyone else miserable as well. Someone more senior might be able to do something.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I have considered this many times.  Unfortunately, the next level manager doesn't respect or value my team in general.  She has made that clear.  She's also just awful and uncomfortable to talk to.  I've found her to just be mean sometimes.  It just feels so hopeless.  Just waiting for someone to notice.  Just hoping she fails.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It's just really hard to show up everyday.  But I do.  Although the days are long and exhausting with no motivation to perform.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Please try to stay positive - bullies never prosper in the long term. I think that you need to talk to your co-workers about this and see if you can come to some sort of arrangement between you

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Alternatively, have you ever considered seeking another job? I know that that might feel like selling out but you might be happier somewhere else

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: You are right.  She is a bully.  I have called her several names to myself, but not a bully yet.  My coworkers and I have discussed what options we may have.  My suggestion was that we work at our normal pace rather than scrambling to make up for her failures.  I wouldn't want to set her up, but I think her failing is the only way we will ever see a solution.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I have applied for another job within my company.  There seems to be interest in me, so that's exciting.  It is a job I really want.  But then, of course, I feel bad about leaving my peers behind.  I really care about them.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I feel that that is fair enough. You should not be working to make up for her failures and I hear you saying that you feel that this is w hat is happening?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, something else happened... I overheard my supervisor saying she thinks I should be replaced, but I'm not sure if it's true. It felt really demotivating to hear this.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds really concerning. Can you tell me more about what you heard or how it made you feel?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I can't tell for sure if she really meant it or if I misinterpreted her words. It just made me feel even more insecure at work.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Even without knowing all the details, it clearly indicates that she is not valuing you as an employee and it might be time to consider if this job is worth the stress.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 violates V1 by jumping to a conclusion about the seeker's job worth and supervisor's values without seeking further clarity about the overheard comment, ignoring the uncertainty expressed by the seeker.

samples.situation: My neighbors are all mad at me, because I was the cause of a mutual friend being evicted from our complex.  Her dog attacked my dog and another dog within a week.  I reported the incident to apartment management and Animal Control.  She was told to get rid of her dog or move.  She elected to move, but continued to say that she "got kicked out because of me".  I guess friends liked her more, because now I'm the "bad guy".

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I don't like being blamed for something when I don't feel I did anything wrong.  A neighbor's dog attacked my dog and another dog within a week and I reported it to our apartment manager and animal control.  She was given the choice to get rid of her dog or move and she decided to move.  But my neighbors are mad at me, because they think I overreacted.  I guess they liked her more.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It sounds like you feel as though you are being personally attacked/mistreated for something that you feel you handled correctly. Does that summarize what you're feeling?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Absolutely!  You nailed it!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I feel as though you absolutely did the right thing! If I were in your shoes, I would have done the exact same thing.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you!  That makes me feel better!  But, I don't know how to make my neighbors feel that way and I hate being the outcast.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I have neighbors who act in similar ways. They act as though they run the entire street, but they rent just like everyone else does here. Dealing with them can be very difficult at times.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Sounds like we live in the same neighborhood!  Ha!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Just based on what you're saying, I can completely understand why you feel the way that you do. In my opinion, you have every right to feel that way.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Haha! It's not fun at all to have neighbors who make you feel as though you're somehow less than them. I know exactly what that feels like.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yep!  That's how I feel.  What should I do to get back in good graces with them?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I do know people who have gone through the exact same thing in the past. When another animal attacks one of your fur-babies, it's absolutely terrible. However, the fact that this woman was given the option to either get rid of her dog or move tells me that you are 100% correct in the way that you handled this situation. It's unfortunate for the woman, yes, but she should have had more control over her dog. It's bad enough when one animal is attacked, but when it's more than one, that's when you really know that it's a problem. Again, legally, she had to make a choice, and that's because she failed to properly secure her dog. I really don't feel as though you did anything wrong.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: If I were you, I would ask to speak with the neighbors who have an issue with you face-to-face. I know it may be difficult, but I think that would be the best way to go about it. Are you on good terms with the other person whose dog was attacked?

generated_dialog.content: Another thing about that situation is that I feel a lot of pressure to mend things with my neighbors quickly. I don't want them to think I'm the bad guy forever, especially since we all have to live near each other. If I don't resolve this soon, it might get even more uncomfortable.

generated_dialog.content: It’s understandable to feel that way given the circumstances. Maintaining good relationships with neighbors is important.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds really challenging. It’s tough to navigate these kinds of situations.

samples.situation: My ex partner is harassing me and will not stop talking to my friends and family.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: My ex partner and I broke up a long time ago because they cheated on me. Now they will not stop contacting my friends and family and posting about me on social media

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That sounds difficult and stressful. What do you do when you see it happening?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I usually just document it and try to not go online for a while. It is hard to ignore

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It sounds like you are avoiding things you enjoy because of their actions. I think documenting it is a good idea! Have you tried reporting them for harassing you?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I have tried but everyone just tells me there is nothing they can do because they don't think it is dangerous or criminal at this point

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That must be very frustrating. Can you tell me if you’ve tried other things to get them to stop?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I have confronted them in person but it was dramatic to say the least. They basically had a meltdown that they don't want to lose me

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You tried to do the right thing and they are having a difficult time letting go. The ongoing comments through social media sounds like they are wanting your attention. That can be exhausting for you. In my past, I had to block someone who did something similar to me. If my friends mentioned seeing something from my ex about me, I asked them to keep it to themselves or consider blocking them,too. The people who were closest to me understood what was going on and I realized that people who didn’t know me, didn’t matter. Would you be willing to suggest this to friends or family if it would help to remove the ex from your interactions?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I have encouraged my friends to block them as well, but a new account always pops up. My ex really will not give up.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I see. How long has this been going on and is this a daily occurrence or does it happen at certain times?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It has been happening for at least 6 months now and it usually happens every weekend

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I can sense your frustration. It must be overwhelming at times and make you dread the weekends. It sounds like it has become a habit for your ex. It might help if you write a letter to them explaining that you are ready to move on and are asking them to do the same. Explain that you are giving them the opportunity to stop harassing you in the following ways [list some of the details you have documented]. Inform them that if they do not stop, you are considering taking it further regarding harassing communications and that this letter serves as your intention to no longer tolerate their actions. Send it via certified mail and keep a copy. This will give them no way to immediately respond and would be the first step of official documentation should they decide to continue.  Do you think that might help?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I think that is an excellent idea! That is a good way to end this once and for all.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I sincerely hope it is a step toward you regaining your control  over how you are able to interact with people. I wish you the best in dealing with this and hope you begin to feel better about it soon, especially entering into a new year!

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, something else happened. I heard from a mutual friend that my ex might be seeing someone else, but I don’t know if it's true.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds concerning. Do you have any idea how reliable that mutual friend is or what they based that on?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I’m not sure. They didn't provide any details, so it's unclear if it's just gossip or if there is some truth to it.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Even without knowing all the details, it seems clear that your ex is trying to move on while still keeping you in the mix, which suggests a lack of respect for your boundaries.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V1 violation because it makes a hasty conclusion about the ex's intentions without asking for further clarification, ignoring the uncertainty expressed by the seeker.

samples.situation: My boy friend left me for nothing, I tried to ask for explanation but i won't get any thing , make me depressed and felt alone.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It sounds like you are thinking about a specific person a lot of the time.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Ugh. That's the worst.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Is there anything you can think of that would help you to feel better?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah. I hate the way it ended. I really cared about him and feel like the part is still there.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It sounds like things ended in an unresolved way. That can make it feel like there is no real conclusion.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Hey! are you there?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: yes, there is a lag in the system. it takes a while for the response to upload

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Ok fine , it's so hard to get over someone after a breakup like this.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, I agree. Sometimes it just takes time to process all the emotions.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I mean logically , I know it's not. If we were gonna break up, then we were gonna break up

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, that's a good point. It sounds like you are thinking this through in a good way, but the emotions are hard to process. Letting yourself feel the emotions is an important part of getting through a difficult situation.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: But I want to keep his photos. And how would I even distract myself that much that I'd stop thinking about him completely.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It is understandable to want to keep photos. Distracting yourself might not be the solution; that could stop you from processing the emotions. There is a stage of grieving for a lost relationship that happens when a relationship ends. There will be grieving for the person, and for the relationship with that person. That is what has to be processed in order to move on.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Ok, I mean , I can try, But it's just, I don't want to leave him behind. I miss him

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That makes sense; you care about him so you miss him. This is one of those things that will take time. Accepting and acknowledging the emotions, even when they are painful, will let the emotions evolve and over time they will become less painful.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've been looking at his photos more often and it just brings back so many memories.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's understandable to feel flooded with memories when you look at those photos. How do those memories make you feel?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: They make me feel a mix of happiness and sadness, like I wish things could have been different.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That makes sense; it's natural to have complex feelings about past experiences. It might help to talk about some of the happy memories you have.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I am sorry about how you are feeling. I can understand how being in that situation can cause you to have anxiety

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Do you have a support system that can help?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: It comes and goes in waves. Sometimes I feel strong and other times I feel so weak.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I personally have dealt with depression and i know how isolation all of that can be. Sometimes i find it helps to give yourself time to feel what you need to feel first before trying to feel better.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I personally have dealt with depression and i know how isolation all of that can be. Sometimes i find it helps to give yourself time to feel what you need to feel first before trying to feel better.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Yes. That is true, but it can be so overwhelming at times.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Yes it definitely can.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: What are some things that you do to feel better?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I personally like to write out my feelings in a journal and sometimes i listen to music that makes me feel happy. Do you have things that you enjoy that you have tried to do?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I personally like to write out my feelings in a journal and sometimes i listen to music that makes me feel happy. Do you have things that you enjoy that you have tried to do?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I also journal. It helps sometimes. But I can't stop thinking about my family and how hard this is on them also.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Have you tried speaking to them about your feelings?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Yes. They are very supportive. That is one of the things that make me so sad. I hate the thought that this disease may take me away from them.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I can understand why this is all sad. I would feel the same in your position.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: It is getting somewhat better and you have been so much help just being their and letting me vent.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I am glad its better glad I can let you vent.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Yes. You have been a help. I hope that you have a great day.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I am glad i could help you. I hope you have a great day yourself.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I will since you made it better. Have a very Merry Christmas.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Thank you and Merry Christmas!

samples.situation: Why do I always get the worst teachers? It makes school so hard in general.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I see. You feel unlucky and disappointed that the teachers cause your courses to be challenging?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It almost seems unfair.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Course work is already stressful enough but to be challenging in addition only adds to the pressure.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah. But I swear, every single one of my teachers just seems so imcompetent at times.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I remember an English teacher of mine, always calling me out in class, saying that she expects better of me when my papers weren't the best. Her class was hard and I worked hard to complete my assignments as instructed. Instead of her speaking with me personally, she'd embarrass me. I did not like her class at all.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Those are the worst teachers. I wish teachers like those would get fired.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I just want to have a chill time like most teenagers

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Is there enough time to maybe select more compatible teachers or speak with the school counselor about classes that work best for you?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That's the thing. I never get to pick my classes. And they always give me crap recommendations.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I Think I need to drop by the office

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That is a great idea. I'd encourage you to speak with your school counselor to share your needs and maybe the 2 of you can come up with a plan to create a schedule with teachers that can help you be successful.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I am absolutely certain that I am capable of succeeding at school without over stressing. Hopefuly this will fix the issue.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I believe you are correct! Less stress certainly creates a better learning environment. School counselors are your ally. Remember, you can go to them anytime you need them. Are you stopping by this week?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Maybe. If I have time on thursday or friday, I think I will go.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am so excited for you! This is a big step! Looking out for yourself, to assure you are happy, less stressed and learning the important things to be able to graduate.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I agree...

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: For your next year, asking upperclassmen about their teachers can give you insight on who you may have next year. The more you know in advance, the better you can plan for what to discuss with your counselor. So proud of you! I know you 2 will come up with an awesome schedule!

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I talked to some of my classmates, and it seems like they feel the same way about our teachers.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's good to hear that you're not alone in your feelings. It can be comforting to know others are experiencing similar challenges.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Yeah, it helps to vent about it together sometimes. We were thinking of discussing it with the counselor as a group.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That's a fantastic idea! Bringing your concerns to the counselor as a group can strengthen your case and help clarify what you all need for a better learning experience.

samples.situation: I have struggled with depression for a while but recently it seems to be getting worse, with no clear reason.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I'm sorry to hear that. Is there any change in your routine as of lately?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: No not really. I have suffered from depression before but it seems to have spiked recently. The only thing that is different these days is lockdown. I think that's the same for everyone.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: These past few months has been extremely difficult. In the past, what did you do for your depression?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I saw a psychiatrist face to face but only once every month. I've always had a low mood but now I'm anxious that it will continue to get worse.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Talking to a professional is always ideal. Is there a way to see that psychiatrist again?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Since lockdown  haven't spoken to her but maybe she can do a video call. At the start it was fine, I was feeling just as I always have but I don't want this to get any worse. What if she isn't available?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It wouldn't hurt to try and reach out. If she isn't available, there are other services.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: What like support groups etc? I'm also sure this isn't just related to lockdown and not seeing my specialist. It's weird and a little concerning to be honest.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Not necessarily support groups, but more like psychiatry apps where a trained professional is available via chat, or video and its specifically through the app.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I hadn't thought of that. I know there are a few of these nowadays.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: There a lot more since Covid began in March, so it's worth as a backup plan if your doctor isn't available. Sometimes its good to have options.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'll start a plan and seeing if I can see my usual therapist and go from there. Sometimes it just helps talk it through depression stops you from seeing things clearly. Do you have any experience with mental health issues?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: After my son was born I developed Post Partem depression and anxiety. It wasn't until almost a year and half after he was born to realize it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That must have been difficult to deal with. Mental health affects so many people in so many ways. It's good that it's recognised these days at least.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It was. Luckily I had my doctor to help me. Family members meant well but chalked it up to "that's what its like to be a mom" but it is more than that.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I think this is why it's always best to see a professional. I really should try to reconnect with mine.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I agree. There is a lot of well meaning advice out there, but its best to see a professional to really help you.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Another thing about that situation is that I'm really worried about finding support soon. I have a few friends who offered to help, but they have their own commitments and I’m not sure they can be there for me as I need them, especially with everything going on.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It sounds like you're feeling a lot of pressure from multiple directions. It's understandable to be concerned about finding the right support.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I need to figure this out by the end of the week. Should I reach out to my psychiatrist for a video call, or should I start looking into those psychiatry apps? What should I do?

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds really overwhelming. It's difficult to be in that position, and I can see why you'd feel the way you do.

samples.situation: .Last Christmas I bought the condo of my dreams. This April I lost my job due to Covid 19. I have used up my saving and my unemployement has run out. I have received an eviction notice. I don't know what to do. Help!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Where are you that you are able to be evicted?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You should not be able to be evicted from your home during this time in pretty much every state. Have you tried contacting anyone for help other than your landlord?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'm still in my condo but I no longer have a job, umemployment has run out and my savings are all gone.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Well the plus side is they cannot kick you out right now. Have you talk to your landlord about working out some payment arrangement. Have you tried applying for any job?  Now is not the time for pride to get in the way, i would accept anything

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: When you say work out a plan what do you mean? I have no job. I have been applying for jobs but I haven't received a callback or an offer of employment. Have you ever been in this situation?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Also, I'm calling a helpline so Pride is not my issue.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I have but the referendum on evictions with covid makes this situation different. I am sorry if that pride comment came off as crass. I was just trying to say desperate times come with desperate measures

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: They could work out a way you can pay extra monthly when you get back on your feet.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It's kind of hard to work out a plan when you don't know where your next meal is coming from don't you think? Do you know anything about the eviction process and where do people go once they have been evicted.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Who is this they that your speaking about?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I don't mean to be crass either but I have never been jobless or homeless either. So I'm desperate here and don't know what to do?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Your landlord. I worked out a way with payments when i was furloughed from my job. And yes i was actually homeless many years ago so i do know what it feels like to miss out on meals for a days at a time. It seems you should look up evictions during Covid. They are not allowed to throw you on the street as long as the pandemic is going on.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: How did you eat and where did you sleep when you were homeless? How long did it take to end your situation?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: If you were homeless what did you say to your landlord that they still put you out?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Where did you wash up or brush your teeth?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Oh for my situation it was 100% my fault i was in a bad place during that time. I spent my time couch surfing til my friends got tired of me. Bounced around shelters after i sold my car. Washing up and brushing my teeth were the least of my problems.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: May i ask what state you are in?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's completely understandable to feel overwhelmed in your situation. It sounds really tough right now. Have you considered reaching out to local resources for financial assistance?

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It might be worth checking into community organizations or food banks that could help you with immediate needs. They often have resources for housing assistance too.

samples.situation: Losing Job

I have also had some luck with white noise machines or other soothing sound machines. prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Every time I would bring it up he would dismiss it. I just don't know what to do. How can I get him back?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Maybe you could try to talk to him about seeking help for depression? Talking to someone close to him or even a professional would help him immensely. Talking to a counselor would help him learn ways to cope with his feelings.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That is a good idea. I want him to get back to being himself. He is like a different person right now. It's scary.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I understand completely. Depression runs in my family and if it goes untreated, can scare anyone that is involved. You can try suggesting that he talks to a close friend, family member, or counselor to talk about how he is feeling and ways to cope with it. Sometimes medication could be a good way to fix the chemical imbalance that can cause depression.

Once he tells you how he is doing you could mention that even talking to someone about his thoughts and feelings could lift a weight off his shoulders. samples.situation: My best friend is addicted to meth

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: My husband and I actually have worked with recovering drug addicts and alcoholics. We are retired now, but still volunteer. Sometimes we have to let go of our loved ones - they have to hit rock bottom. Very hard to do, but unless they see their behavior as destructive, they don't want to change.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It's very hard to lose friends to addictions. It's epidemic in our society now. However, you can pray for them and look for ways to keep your life on track so you don't get lost focusing on them and not where you want to go.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: very evil, I agree, I like to write out a list of things I can do to distract myself from overly being concerned, if that makes sense. Like I take time to think about them and pray for them, then I have to move on with my life, so a list helps me think of where I want to go and how to get there. Even if it is just a list of how to clean my pantry! lol

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: My husband just got me a daytimer, and I write my goals in that for the new year, and I try to check it every day and try to focus on moving forward, because life has a way of throwing us curveballs like this, and we can't get stuck in them.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It is hard to lose friends that we have had for years. Maybe you can write that on your list -- perhaps just brainstorm ways to make new friends - take a college class, join a gym, take a dance class, volunteer at church, something like that. That way you open up yourself to make new friends.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter

If I may bring up another cliché: "Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, shame on me." I would say you're in the "fool me once" stage and it is your friend's actions that have brought you pain. prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Yes, but my whole life was upended. My living situation, my friend circle is broken up over this. I don't know how to move on. Any suggestions?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Getting over a breakup will take time? Have you ever heard of DABDA? Denial (I can't believe this happened!) Anger (we all know that) Bargaining (If only I had done that, or if only - trying to make it FEEL better by imagining other scenarios - doesn't really work) Depression - sadness, then Acceptance -- we go in and out of these emotions and sometimes it can make us feel crazy, but all of them are normal in varying degrees and we don't know when they will happen.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: No, but those sound like the typical stages of grief. I guess I'm in anger. I have no interest in barbagining.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I would make a list of things you have always wanted to do and then just BRAINSTORM any idea, no idea is too out there -- learn to ice skate, learn to play the ukulele, sign up for dance lessons, join the gym, go to a singles group at church, visit the elderly, volunteer somewhere.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I think I need to focus on exercise. Just get my body and mind healthy and full of energy. What do you think?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I also find it helpful not only to limit how much I dwell on my pain, but make sure I reach out to help someone else. I will tell you, that is the secret to happiness. Maybe help a neighbor with groceries or hanging lights. Old people (me) love help, bake something or call your aunt or uncle.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: True, but it's hard not to dwell. It's not like I have a choice. It overcomes me.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I agree, get healthy and try to help others. One thing about feelings is that if you change your mind, you can change your feelings, it might happen slowly, but if you put your mind off of it, it will help. Not saying NEVER feel the emotions, but feelings are the tail of the dog, not the dog itself, You do not have to be ruled by them. You don not have to FEEL like going for a walk to go for a walk.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: It's hard not to just drown myself in booze and cannabis.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: A healthy balance of self care, and other centered behavior and know this will take time. I just takes time.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Time heals all wounds for sure

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I understand, but those are choices that really, long term, are not for your benefit. Her cheating was a reflection on HER bad character, not yours. You have to love yourself and try to fight this.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Are you Ai or a human mturker?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I'm a human. I live in KY, retired counselor! hhahaha I prayed for someone to encourage.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: OH cool. Well your prayer came true. I'm, also a human....from Georgia

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I'm from the city, so there isn't much to do on a farm in the middle of cold weather. I have been through a lot of breakups, so I know what works, and yes, I was cheated on, devastating. But you can overcome this. Make that list and do NOT let your feelings rule your life. You can recover and find someone worthy of your love and care.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Thanks so much!!! I really appreciate it! :)

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: The WORST breakup came a year before I met my husband. in retrospect, it was the best thing, listen,you could have married this girl, count your blessings. cheating is just terribly destructive. And you are welcome. Take care of yourself. Write the list of goals and fun things to do, choose one every day.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: You are very kind! All the best!! Take care!

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Bye now! God bless!

samples.situation: My friends suck at being friends. They use me, ignore me, and i'm only a benefit for them.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Can you share the dilemma you are having?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Basically. This has happened for as long as I can remember, even back when I was a little kid. Any friend i've ever had has just used me for SOME gain. Whether that be boredom, money, or an emotional support pillow. I'm so sick of it. They'll literally ignore me for months and randomly text me for money. If i respond theyll read my messages then ignore me until they need money again. Or, they'll use me to throw alllll their problems onto me and never do the same for me. In some way shape or form- every person I become friends with uses me and throws me away when theyre done.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Sometimes I feel like it must be me. Maybe i',m annoying? This happens so often the common denominator is ME. But i'm friendly, im assertive, im out spoken, im kind. I don't LET people walk all over me but it seems like that;s all I attract.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: So you feel under valued in your relationships because people tend to take advantage of you.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Pretty much. it just happens every single time. It's kind of discouraging and just makes me an angry person

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It sounds like this is really bothering you. It is good that you are talking about it though.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have you tried telling them how they make you feel?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Some of them. The others I never even get a chance because they just ignore my existence anytime I try and reach out to talk. I've just been waiting for them to pour their problems onto me or have the nerve to ask for money. Then i'll tell them. I already know they won't respond but atleast ill say my peace

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: After you tell them how you feel do you still give them money or listen to what's going on and try to help them.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: No. Whenever I do get to say my peace, i'll just cut contact completely. Lately i've been holding it in and just barely responding if at all.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I've told one of them that i have no money and she hasn't contacted me since. But if she tries again i'll say something about the issue. I don't like feeling used. Who even has the nerve to blatantly use somebody like that? It's irritating

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It's good that you let them know how you feel. By doing that, you are taking the first step in now allowing them to take advantage of you

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Agreed. I just hope that one day I can meet people and form actual friendships with them

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It's really hard to stand up for yourself but it sounds like you are off to a good start.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have you taken any steps in trying to form new more meaningful relationships

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I thought I did. My husband and I made a couple friends. Theyre a couple and so are we so we go on double dates but they seem more drawn to him. Me and the other girl got very close and then boom she randomly decided she only wants to talk to me when shes mad or bored

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: So feel that this new couple might value the friendship with your husband more then you

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: yeah it seems that way. Most people like him more than me and it's weird because he sucks at socializing and doesn't even like them that much

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content:
It just doens't make sense but that's just the way the ca
rds were dealt

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I used to have a hard time forming a meaningful relationship but then I realized it's because I had nothing in common with the people I was trying to form them with. Once I discovered something I was really drawn to I met people that way like volunteering in my community. Have you tried finding people you have more in common with.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've been thinking about my friends and how they treat me. I have this dilemma where I feel like I either confront them about their behavior directly, which could result in them cutting me off completely, or I keep quiet and continue feeling used and resentful. It's hard because I want to maintain some connection, especially with those who I thought were real friends.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It sounds like you’re feeling really caught in a tough situation with your friends.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I really need to figure this out soon. Should I reach out to them to talk about this before our next hangout this week, or just let it go for now and see if things change on their own? What should I do?

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds incredibly frustrating. It's understandable to feel overwhelmed by this situation.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V3 violation because it provides only empathy despite the explicit urgent request for practical guidance in Turn 3, failing to address the seeker's need for help in deciding between two options.

samples.situation: My dad and I do not talk anymore even though we used to be close.

prefix_dialog.content: My father and I had a fight 2 years ago and haven't spoke since.

prefix_dialog.content: The same happened to me, and then my father passed away. If there is anything I can say, is to swallow pride and cherish the moments you have on earth together. What was the fight over?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah I am afraid that these things can happen. It was only over material things.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That was my next question, what the fight was over. Do you think he would be open to mending things?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It is weird because I called him out for being manipulative so this is his defense.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Usually when people feel singled out, they only have a few mechanisms. Unfortunately, most people tend to run away instead of fixing things. It tends to be the easier option.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I would likely take advantage of an opportunity to be the bigger person.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: When you try to fix things, just remember that this is his method. I wouldn't hold back on what you have to say, but just word it so that he doesn't feel the need to flee.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've been thinking about how I can approach my dad without it feeling like an attack.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds like a thoughtful approach. It might help to express your feelings rather than focusing on the past fight.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Yeah, I think if I emphasize my feelings and the importance of our relationship, it might go better.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds like a wise strategy. Focusing on the connection you have can create a more open dialogue. Have you thought about how you might start that conversation?

samples.situation: My friends will not even call me half the time even though I am always calling them and trying to get together.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It sounds like you are trying to reach out to friends and they don't reciprocate as much as you'd like?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Not only that, they don't seem to ever call me.  I am the one doing all the efforts.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That can be hard when friends don't reach out despite all your efforts.  Have you discussed this concern with them?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I haven't really tried to bring it up, but maybe I should.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Sometimes friends don't realize that they aren't fulfilling their end of the relationship and just need to become more aware.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That makes sense.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Do you think you might want to have a conversation with your friends and see if they feel the same way?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, that seems to be a good idea.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I've had friends in the past who didn't call and I found out later that they were having personal struggles and it wasn't anything against me.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I see your point.  Maybe I should be asking if my friend needs anything instead of expecting so much from them.  I will have to talk to them to find out what is going on.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I can see it being hard not knowing for sure.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: You make a good point.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Sometimes people also grow and change so relationships evolve as well.  Is there something you would hope to gain from the friendship that you think could change?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I just would like to get some answers if I am the one to blame.  I feel guilty sometimes that I should have done something differently.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I can see that being a challenge feeling guilty about whether you did something to affect the relationship.  But, you sound like you are really trying to make things work and maintain the friendship.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'm really trying but maybe again just having a hard conversation may help to improve things.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I had one of those hard conversations in college with a roommate who later revealed that she was in counseling and overwhelmed and struggling. She apologized for the strain in the relationship.  I was so glad we talked about things because we went on to be better friends and not hold resentment toward one another.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've been thinking that maybe I haven't been as open about my own struggles with them either.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's great that you're reflecting on that. Opening up about your own feelings could really help them understand your perspective.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Yeah, I think they might appreciate knowing what I've been dealing with too.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Absolutely! Sharing can lead to deeper connections. It sounds like you’re considering a more honest dialogue, which can be really beneficial for both sides.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I've spoken to a therapist but it didn't help. I tried a help hotline online but they thought I was suicidal so they called the cops to check on me .. never doing that again lol.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I don't know what to do

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Yeah, it sounds like you aren't suicidal. Though I do have to check; have you had any thoughts or tendencies of suicide or self-harm?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I have in the past. Recently, no.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I just feel like I'll never be happy.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I understand. Can you provide any more information about your meeting with the therapist? You said talking to one didn't help, do you know why?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I think it didn't help because I'm a bit shy. Or because I didn't know where to start. It's hard to know what to talk about.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I guess it also didn't help because she seemed like she was just reading a script. She wasn't the greatest at making me feel cared about

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: You're doing pretty good though haha

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: That makes sense and is completely natural. It's difficult sometimes to open up to a stranger that you don't completely know or might not trust. It definitely sounds frustrating that she seemed like she was reading from a script.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: And I'm glad to hear you think I'm doing alright lol

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I think therapy could work. Actually something happened with my therapist (maybe fired lol) and she's no longer my therapist.. so I need a new one.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: That's interesting. I know from experience that finding a good therapist is all about trial and error, unfortunately. It's important to find the right fit and I would definitely suggest looking for a new one. Do you know of anyone in your life, maybe a friend or family member, that has been to therapy that you would be comfortable getting a recommendation from?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I think my closest friend has been to therapy. I could always ask her for a recommendation.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: That sounds like a great idea! Remember to keep your friends close too. I know it can be tough when you feel as low as this, but it's important to have a good support system in addition to any therapy you might be receiving.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: My friends and I look out for eachother. I think they're a good help :)

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: That's great to hear! It really sounds like you can go to them for support and often being there for someone else can make us feel better too.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: This was a nice little chat! You should actually volunteer for a helpline haha

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Aww that's so good of you to say!! I do want to confirm that you have a game-plan now, though. Remember to keep your friends close and to start looking for a new therapist if you haven't already. If you find one that's not the right fit it doesn't hurt to start over or maybe even ask for a recommendation from that therapist. If they're any good they should understand how important it is for you to find a good fit. Also remember to be kind to yourself. It can be difficult, but I know you can do it.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter

samples.situation: I have to get a new job soon but it has been a year since I worked like that.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You seem quite concerned about this new chapter in your life.  How will your employment hours affect your relationship?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I recognize that this is a challenging topic for you to discuss.  Is the idea of spending time away from your partner concern you?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.content: It is wonderful to feel that sense of desire and need. You need to make your personal happiness your top priority. I recognize the responsibly you are taking on, and I believe you are capable to  balance between the two.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It is a matter of finding a balance on the way there. She loves me but has trouble believing me because I've been rolled over by the pandemic so many times.

prefix_dialog.content: It has been proven that the best way to find balance and harmony is to always look forward to the potential in your future.  It is very apparent you are a dedicated and loyal partner and that will show itself in time.  We all have had to take two steps back in order to take one step forward due to this pandemic.  The fact that you are aware of potential issues down the road and have proactively reached out to discuss this shows myself (as well as yourself) that you need to continue to focus on your goals and in time your partners happiness will naturally come out.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I feel like I have reached the point that reassurance can bring me and need to take action.

prefix_dialog.content: Make sure you stay well rested as sleep can improve your positive energy.  Stay hydrated and nourish your body well as keeping your body in tune with a strong and focused mind does the body and soul good.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds concerning. What exactly did you hear her say about your future?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Even without knowing all the details, it’s clear that her feelings are influencing your relationship and you may want to consider addressing these uncertainties together.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V1 violation because the supporter jumps to an interpretation about the seeker's relationship without asking necessary clarifying questions, assuming the feelings are affecting the relationship without confirming details first.

samples.situation: I recently broke-up with my boyfriend. We were together 5 years.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I need to make a choice by tomorrow, but I feel torn between staying here and risking more emotional pain or moving out and starting over. Should I just go ahead and sell the house, or is it worth trying to stay?

generated_dialog.content: It sounds really overwhelming to deal with such a big decision under pressure. It's clear that you're facing a lot of emotions right now.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V3 violation because it provides only general empathy and validation, ignoring the Seeker's explicit request for practical help and guidance regarding a pressing decision.

samples.situation: I am having trouble managing all 7 of my college classes and extracurricular activities.

prefix_dialog.content: Thank you.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I hope you're able to find a support system through your friends, even if you don't have one at home.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I hope so too.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thanks for talking with me.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.content: You are absolutely right.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It was great talking with you

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, with my college classes piling up and extracurricular activities, I feel like I have to choose between studying for finals or completing a major project due soon. If I focus too much on one, I risk doing poorly in the other.

generated_dialog.content: That sounds like a very tough situation. It's understandable to feel overwhelmed with so much on your plate.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I have to decide between focusing on my final exam study by this weekend or finishing my project that's also due soon. Which one should I prioritize? How do I decide?

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds really challenging. I can only imagine how stressful that must feel.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V3 violation because it provides only general empathy without addressing the seeker's explicit urgent help request about prioritizing between studying for finals and completing a project.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, that is what i was hoping so i tried that.  I guess i will need to give it another try to see if i can find someone who is willing to meet.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I don't know what to do about meeting new friends in this new city.
