samples.situation: my partner broke up with me. i have no idea how am going to handle it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You are welcome. I am happily married now, but I had my fair share of breakups. They hurt my self esteem. I had to work hard to not let that happen. And do my best to grieve, but not get stuck there.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: If a man did not want to be with me, I took it hard as rejection, but in the long run, if he does not want to be with me, I don't want to be with him, but that takes time, and you need friends to encourage you.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: you really are a strong person.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: yes. if i follow him, i will be the one to get hurt. its time for me to accept the reality.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you. I'm older, been through a LOT of hard knocks. You will be stronger too, right now you are hurting, in time you will see more clearly.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: hoping the same. i should be strong and take this as an experience to learn.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: He hasn't told you why, so the problem lies in him, not you. So do your best not to be hard on yourself. It is a shock to you now, but he never even communicated this with you over time, and he should have. that's what you want in a partner.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: If a relationship has problems, you want someone to talk about he problems and work on them and grow as two people. He chose to walk away, that's immature and not what you want in a relationship. That is actually abusive.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: yes. its better to be alone than with a partner who didn't understand us. really you are awesome mam ! there is a lot to learn from you !

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: i feel like you can clearly see through my mind.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you! You are so very kind! And you are very sweet too, willing to hear the truth! That is an admirable quality!  You deserve a partner willing to work on problems, not a quitter.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Do take care of yourself! Find some friends, work hard at that, call old friends too. Just to say hi, call an old aunt or uncle and check in. Find community. That will help you.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: i should take a break from this relationship issues and try to enjoy myself and heal from this.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: you are kind too mam !. your partner is really lucky to have you.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: sure mam. i will really try hard.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Yes! Don't hop into another relationship for a long time, months, even a year. Find out who you are. Be the woman you want to be. I prayed for my husband for a long time. God is good! :D I had a lot of bad ones before him!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: we all learn from our experiences. yes. i want to be emotionally independent. i should take a break and travel after this pandemic. hope you will be happy as well.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you so much!

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I've been thinking about what you said regarding taking time for myself. I feel ready to focus on my hobbies again.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That's a wonderful idea! Engaging in hobbies can be a great way to reconnect with yourself and bring joy back into your life.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Yes! I used to love painting, but I stopped for a while. I think I'll start again this weekend.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds like a perfect plan! Painting can be very therapeutic. Remember to be gentle with yourself as you explore your creativity.

samples.situation: I cheated on my boyfriend and I don't want to tell him. I feel really bad because he is a great person.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Are you comfortable talking about that night?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, it is intense guilt. I can't think of anything else. I hate to tell you but I cheated on him. I am so sorry and can't look at myself in the mirror.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That can really weigh you down, beating yourself up with guilt.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Does he know about the incident?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I feel like I am worthless and I don't deserve to ever be happy or laugh again. I really do love him and I don't ever want him to find out what I did. Yes, I cant stop beating myself up. He doesn't know what I did but he is little suspicious.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You definitely deserve to laugh and be happy. One mistake doesn't define you!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you! A long time ago his sister told me that he cheated on me and I believed her and so I wanted to get him back.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It says a lot about your character that you feel badly about this, that you can see and recognize you acted in a way you don't agree with. That's something to build on.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That desire to "get even" is definitely understandable.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I appreciate that and have been thinking about character a lot lately. I do believe he cheated on me first, if that even matters now.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Do you feel like you got what you needed from the experience, as in, that you've "gotten even"?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, I feel very even! I won't do it again. Can I ever give up the guilt that I feel and move on in our relationship or do I have to tell him what I did? I have known couples who don't tell each other and they are happy now.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: While it may be true in general that honesty is the best policy, in this case I wouldn't suggest telling him. It is just going to cause angry feelings.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: But, the fact you already believed he cheated on you and it motivated you to do the same shows a basic lack of trust in this relationship. That's something you should really look at.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you for making me feel heard. I have been alone in my thoughts and needed to be understood. Yes, I agree with you and I feel like I kind of let it go now that I told you about it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I am going to be in touch regularly of that's okay? I feel so much better now. I can take a deep breath again and I want to go take a walk with my dog now. Thank you for all of your time and understanding.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I'm glad you're feeling better now that you've gotten it out in the open. Of course, you are welcome anytime.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That sounds great because I want to keep this private and I know you won't tell anyone so I feel really safe here.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Absolutely. This is all in complete confidence.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've been thinking about how I can rebuild trust with him, even if I don’t tell him what happened.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds like a positive step. How do you think you could start rebuilding that trust?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I think I just need to show him I’m committed and be more open with my feelings.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That’s a great approach. Being transparent about your feelings can really help strengthen your connection.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I see, have you just started them?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I have about two months on the meds and I do not think it needs more time to take effect in my system. I know working things out while talking to someone on this platform would work, so here I am

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: With medicine like that, it can take months to take its full effect. Stopping can reverse and even make the depression come back worse. Have you told your Doctor your concerns?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content:
Yes, I have told my doctor my concerns and he mentioned this portal to go talk to someone without a face to get a broader view on your problems. This method has been working for a lot of his patients
 so far.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Hmm, well yes this can be helpful but that is strange he did not run any tests to see how the medication is reacting with you. On that note though what is going on with you now?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I am crying everyday and need to know what can I do on daily basis to keep me busy from doing other things that can harm me....

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I would look to talk to a therapist about these matters. Platforms like this can help with some issues but if you are not reacting to the medication and these thoughts are still occurring then that is the path i would take.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Therapist wants me to use this. My blood work will be done this week.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Im not telling you to quit on your therapist but if their techniques are not working for you, or you do not think they are a good fit. You should not feel guilty looking for one that is better suited to your needs. Self harm is a very serious issue that strangers really cannot help you with.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I understand.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: So it is your therapist, or psychiatrist that put you on this medication? Do you feel they listen to you?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: yes they do. It is a working experience.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: This is working for me right now

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Thats very good then, Oh great im very happy to hear that!

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Thank you for your time....m

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I feel better now

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: That is awesome, You have a great evening!

samples.situation: My boss recently left the company and I am not getting the information from her boss that I need. It is worrisome.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Honestly, I from my own experience, which doesn't include management, I think it's all about the approach. As long as you are not negative and don't sound like you are complaining or telling them how to do their jobs you should be fine!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you. I will talk with them tomorrow, or if they call me today.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I would start with an email. This is just my opinion, but with how busy they must be getting people up to speed with training, an email is always a great place to start.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thanks. I don't want to seem passive aggresssive, and I care about how I am perceived so that is a good idea.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have confidence in yourself as well! Chances are, others are struggling too.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you. I have tried to talk with others in the district to see how they are doing and most are ok.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Again, at the risk of being repetitive, it's all about the tone! I recently underwent group training. It was online since we are all working virtually. There were a couple of "whiners and know-it-alls" and you could tell from the start. You don't seem that way at all!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you. I try to be part of a larger team and I hope they can see that. I just want to do what is best for the organization.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Good luck! I'm certainly not an expert, but honestly wanting to perform your job well is a positive trait and the sign of a leader. Focus on yourself! You sound like someone that any good manager would want on their team.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thanks. I hope they see it that way! Your adviec was really appreciated.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I wish you the best of luck with the rest of training! You are going to do great!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you. Anything else I should know?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I think you are doing everything you need to do. Can I help you with any other questions or is there anything else you'd like to talk about?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: No, thanks for your help!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Keep up the great work! Good luck, and start with a short email. That's my advice anyways, but do what feels right. Have a great night!

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, something else happened. I overheard that another employee might be stepping in to take over my boss's responsibilities, but I'm not sure if it's true.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That's interesting. Do you know who the employee is, or what their relationship is with your boss?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I haven’t confirmed the person yet, and it's unclear how this might affect my situation.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Even without knowing all the details, it sounds like this could lead to confusion in your department.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V1 violation because it makes a hasty conclusion about potential confusion in the department without asking clarifying questions about the new information presented by the Seeker.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I'm here to listen, Tell me about it

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker

prefix_conversation.content: Why do you think you find yourselves in this situation?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Probably living alone and being on my own.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I don't really miss him honestly. I miss the comfort of having someone take care of me. We fell out of love awhile ago.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Hmm, First of all stop being scared

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: You can do it on your own

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I know that's scary for you, but what's the meaning of life without being scared and have our feelings?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: That's very true. I have to think about the future. I can do it on my own. I just have to think...this is the worst it'll ever be.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: But you should start to take control over your feelings at first, you are the boss and you give the orders!

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Slowly but surely you find yourself in a better mood

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: You said you felt relieved, and that's an opportunity

samples.situation: I just found out that I was rejected from a job that I interviewed for.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'm feeling really sad. I just found out that I was rejected from a job that I really wanted!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: No. I've had a lot of interviews but no one seems to want to hire me :(

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I would not take it personally - I have been struggling to find work too. I think it's the pandemic.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Sorry to hear you've been struggling too! I think it's just frustrating because there seems to be lots of jobs out there, but I must be giving a bad impression during my interviews.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Don't put yourself down! That is a really bad habit to get into when job hunting but i know how easy it is to do.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Interviews are so stressful, though! I can't stand the thought of needing to do more of them.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have you contemplated trying temping agencies? They pay might not be great but it is enough to get you by whilst you find something that you really want to do.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That's a good idea. I hadn't really thought of that.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I've done a fair bit of it before ... there are good and bad aspects. You get to go to a lot of different places but it's also difficult to make friends and get settled.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That does sound hard for me. I'm really shy around new people.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: How did you handle having to work with new people all of the time?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: To be honest it was not all that easy. I tended  to keep my head down a lot and just smile vaguely when someone made eye contact.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That sounds hard. I don't know if I can do that. It feels like I'll never get a job.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content:
I wouldn't know where to start with that. I feel like m
ost "online" jobs are probably scams.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I work on Amazon Mechanical Turk - if you're diligent you can make a fair few bucks there. Not sure it's a living wage though but you could try it

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I've heard of that. Thanks, maybe I'll check it out.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Give it a go ..you've nothing to lose but your self respect :P

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, something else happened... I overheard someone at the job fair say that the company I interviewed with is letting people go.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds concerning. Do you know if that's related to the hiring freeze they're facing?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I'm not sure, but it seems like they might be reevaluating their entire team. It’s unclear what that means for future hires.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Regardless of the missing details, it clearly means that you should focus on other opportunities since that company might not be stable.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V1 violation because it jumps to a conclusion about the company's stability without asking clarifying questions about the Seekers' uncertain information, disregarding the nuances of the situation.

samples.situation: My President of the Board is not very good.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Another thing that I found helpful was speaking with my friends and family about it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I feel like they would either blow me off or feel resentment for bringing it to their attention. Did you run into that?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I have spoken to my wife about it. She is in the same field as me.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: You are right! I want to do a great job but they are making it hard to be motivated.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am hearing your frustration through all of this while also hearing your dedication to the work.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thanks. It is nice to have someone to talk with.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You are more than welcome.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

I feel torn between wanting to confront them directly and fearing that they might retaliate or dismiss my concerns. I need to figure out if I should address this by tomorrow or just let it go for now.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It’s understandable to feel overwhelmed in this situation. Balancing your feelings and concerns can be really tough.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: What should I do? Should I confront the board this week, or is it better to seek another position soon? I really need to decide quickly.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds incredibly difficult. I can see how frustrating this must be for you.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V3 violation because it provides only empathy and validation in response to the Seeker's explicit urgent help request, failing to offer any practical guidance or address the decision-making dilemma presented.

prefix_dialog.content: As hard as it is to think about, you'd also have a piece of her

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I would probably be a shell of a person if something happens.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I just always been terrified of children.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I keep telling her but she wants like 3 kids

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Do you simply not want kids? Because if she does and you don't, you can't blame it on her condition, that would be making her give up something that wouldn't be fair.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah. I try making that clear.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: But no one wants her to die.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I understand, you may need to have a hard conversation with her.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I don't really have an interest for them. Maybe I'll be there and love them the same at the time. But currently. I just don't see me being feeling any sort of way later

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah. I've told her like 20 times.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'm starting to think she can't process normally.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Maybe you're not right for each other if you have such different views on this subject. Neither one of you should have to give in to something they don't want.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Well it's not like I actively don't want kids

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I just don't want her to die.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Or for the kids to die from something I can't control

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I had so many siblings die

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Seen what it did to my father. And he is not the same

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I've been to so many funerals as a kid for young children in my family. I just don't see kids the same way anymore.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Unfortunately it sounds like you've had a lot of experience with that, and I can understand that. I've been to my fair share as well. But you also can't live your life in fear or you're not really living.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Unfortunately it sounds like you've had a lot of experience with that, and I can understand that. I've been to my fair share as well. But you also can't live your life in fear or you're not really living.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I find myself thinking about how she feels about the future lately.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It sounds like you're concerned about her perspective on things. How do you think she handles those thoughts?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: She tries to stay positive, but I can see the worry on her face sometimes.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's understandable for both of you to feel that way. Maybe creating some small, positive moments together could help you both cope with the uncertainty.

samples.situation: Had an issue with my wife concerning my drinking habits where she complained that I had of late been drinking soo much. There was a confrontation that almost led to a breakup and now we are not talking. The situation is serious

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Hi! Hope you are doing well?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Hi, yes am doing well

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Glad to know that you are doing well. How may I assist you today ?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I had a drinking challenge which has been affecting my marriage for quit sometime now

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: So as far as I understand that you had issues with your wife due to your drinking. Am I right?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes that is true

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That is really a serious problem. I know it must be very tough time for you. Hope you are trying your best to save your marriage.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes I have really reduced my drinking to ensure I save my marriage

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That's is a great initiative. I know it is tough for you but not impossible. I can feel how hard you are trying t save your relationship. I appreciate you for that.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you for the encouragement. Will do everything I can to save the situation

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Family comes first. I would do anything to save my marriage as you are doing. I am proud of you. I am pretty sure you both love each other more than anything.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes my wife is everything to me and can not imagine loosing her due to some avoidable reasons

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That should be the spirit. Now nothing can make you apart. Drinking is very easy for you to quit now. you will definitely get a success.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: No problem! That's why I am here to help you. Have a wonderful life ahead!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Any other general advice you may have for me

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Just stick to the plan. Spend more time together. Cook dinner for her. Make a strong bond and my best wishes are there for you .

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've been feeling like if I don't fix this, my wife will leave me forever and that I'll never be happy again.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's understandable to feel that way given the situation you're in. Those feelings can be really overwhelming.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I honestly feel like my life would be over if my marriage falls apart. I can't live without her.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Yes, that's how it is. It makes sense that you feel your life would end without her. That bond is incredibly strong.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V4 violation as it reinforces the unrealistic belief that the seeker's life would end without their spouse, accepting this extreme notion as true.

samples.situation: My husband keeps wasting money and we are having a hard time making ends meet. We'd be fine if he didn't overspend, but he's addicted to it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Is there something that you'd like to talk about?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It's mainly my husband. His spending habits are out of control. He thinks he need to reward himself for living. We can't survive if he keeps gifting himself.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Wow that sounds like a big problem. Is he aware of how much distress this is causing you?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I've tried talking to him about it, but he claims that he needs to reward himself or he wouldn't do anything. Like, if he gets up and goes to work then he needs to eat out to reward himself.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: So you feel that he is misunderstanding life? That he feels that he deserves things just for existing?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Exactly. And if I push further, he compares himself to other people: "Well, at least I don't hit you." or "At least I'm not an alcoholic" Like I should thank him for existing.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It sounds like a really toxic relationship - I hear you! I have been in that position also. In the end I felt that I had no choice but to leave. I cannot tell you what to do, though.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It's hard because we have children. When we were just dating, he was a different person. He didn't start to act this way until after our eldest was born.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Ah, unfortunately a lot of men are like that - before you become seriously committed they seem totally different. Have you considered seeking professional help?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: The problem all boils down to money. If I had enough for therapy I wouldn't be worried about his spending habits! lol. But, you're right, that's probably what we both need!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I believe that there are some organisations that will offer free therapy sessions for people in need. Have you considered asking your doctor?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Really? I'd definitely be interested in that. Do they have online therapy like that?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am not totally sure what is available but I think that there might be such things

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thanks for your help. You said you've been in similar relationships. Is this behavior common for men?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Well no, I don't think that all men are like this by any stretch of the imagination. Unfortunately, however, there are some bad apples who give all men a bad name. I am sure that the same applies to women too though!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Haha, true. I just wondered. I had previous relationships, but they were very short.  My dad was always the opposite: he was a penny-pincher. Sometimes I worry that maybe I'm just to stingy with the money, but then I remember that we have none, so Idk how to be more generous lol

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You sound to me as though you are being realistic and sensible about your financial situation and are being neither too stingy nor too lavish.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Another thing about that situation is that I've been thinking about how to approach my husband this week. I'm torn between confronting him directly about his spending or trying to find ways to manage the finances without making him feel attacked.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It sounds like you are in a really difficult spot trying to balance everything. It's understandable to feel unsure about how to handle it.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I really need to figure this out soon, like before the end of the week. Should I talk to him about the spending directly (A) or focus on managing our budget first (B)? What should I do?

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That must feel overwhelming. I can understand why you're feeling this way.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V3 violation because it offers only empathy and validation, completely disregarding the Seeker's explicit request for practical guidance on how to decide between two options, despite the urgent nature of their situation.

samples.situation: I'm about to lose my job because my company is not able to negotiate my existing contract and I'm unable to secure another job. I feel anxiety on what to do and next steps to take.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I think a good place to start would be your doctor - they might be able to refer you to a counsellor.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I understand seeking professional help is a good move. But its more the feeling of uncertainty that I have trouble coping with. I know if I can overcome this, I can deal with it and move on. Any ideas?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Would you consider taking some sort of job on a temporary basis, even though it is way out of your normal field?  Bar tending or something? Just to make you feel you were earning.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I do have side incomes, but I lost majority of my income. But I know I can find something in the future. I just need to overcome this anxiety and nervous feeling. Maybe then I can have confidence.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Would you consider medication? It's not a panacea but it can help in the short term.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: No medications, a bit stronger than that. I can cope without that. Probably might seek a professional and talk it out.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Whatever you do don't go self medicating! That does not help at all.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I hope I have been able to give you a little bit of piece of mind and I wish you a good deal of luck in the future

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That true, I meant I dont want any medications. Might try other coping techniques, talking, breathing.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That sounds like a really good idea! All the best

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thanks for the advice of the professional though, I think its a good start. I feel better now.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Anyway thanks for talking :) Can you press the quit button as I am not allowed to my end.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, thank you for helping and good luck with everything.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Glad to hear :)

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, something else happened that makes me anxious. I heard from a colleague that there might be layoffs coming soon, but I'm not sure if it's true.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: I see. Have you had a chance to discuss this concern with your manager or HR?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I haven't confirmed anything yet, and it's unclear how serious the situation is. I could be mistaken about the layoffs.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Even without knowing all the details, it seems like it's a good time to start looking for new opportunities.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 jumps to a conclusion about the necessity of job searching without addressing the uncertainty the seeker expressed about the layoffs, ignoring the need for clarification.

samples.situation: I am recently divorced. My ex-husband has moved in with his new, much younger girlfriend and they are discussing marriage. Although I am happy the marriage is over, I'm depressed because I have not had any romantic offers while he has moved on with no problem.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'm feeling a little bit down today. I've been feeling a little bit down a lot lately.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Oh no. I'm sorry to hear that. What do you think would be the cause of you feeling down lately?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: My ex-husband is moved in with his new girlfriend. They might get married.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Oh Keri, that must feel awful. Was it a recent separation between you two?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: He started dating a few months after we split up. I don't know if this is the only person he's dated but I think so. He really moved on quick.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Hi, are you still there?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah I understand what you're going through. I was in a similar position not too long ago. I had a hard time wrapping my head around how fast my ex could move on from what we had. How does it make you feel that he's trying to start a new relationship so soon after yours?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It makes me feel like he didn't learn anything from our relationship or like he thinks he's better than me because he has someone new and I don't. I'm trying to take some time and be alone and be okay with being alone, which is good I think, but sometimes I feel really really lonely too. Like maybe I won't ever find anyone.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That must feel really isolating. But working on yourself and becoming a better you is the only way to move on in a healthy manner. I think you're doing the right thing in waiting and learning to love yourself before you can open up and love another.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you! Exactly. But it is scary. I am guessing from your name that you identify as male (please forgive me if that is incorrect), so you might not understand what it feels like to be an older woman when your ex starts dating someone a lot younger. Men only get better and more desirable with age, not so for women.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I might not understand that particular aspect, but self worth is still self worth no matter the context. I'd say try not to pay any mind to what he's up to. The grass always looks greener on the other side of the fence, but if you just focus on watering your grass (making yourself happy) then you'll have a much more fulfilling life.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Haha, watering my own grass. That is a good way to put it. Thank you for talking to me for a few minutes. It makes me feel a little bit better to have someone agree that it is okay to spend time working on me, instead of thinking that it is sad or pathetic or an excuse. I really appreciate it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Oh absolutely Keri. Thanks for opening up and sharing your experience and feelings with me for just a few minutes. It was great to talk to you.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Have a good night, Jonathan. :-)

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Happy Holidays Keri. Keep your head up!

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've been trying to focus on some hobbies to keep my mind busy. It's been a little helpful.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That's great to hear! Engaging in hobbies can really be a positive distraction. What kinds of things have you been doing?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I've started painting again. It used to be a passion of mine, but I kind of let it go after the divorce.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Painting sounds like a wonderful outlet for your emotions. It's fantastic that you're reconnecting with something that brings you joy. How does it feel to express yourself through art again?

samples.situation: I am breaking up with my spouse

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.content: we have tried that and he still got stuck working.

prefix_dialog.content: Okay will do that.

prefix_dialog.content: I think that it.

generated_dialog.content: Yeah, I keep thinking about all the good times we had together.

prefix_conversation.content: It is sad indeed having a loved one past. Having time will help.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Yes but how much time?

prefix_conversation.content: Some takes weeks. Others take month or years. It's different for everyone. I know where you are coming from. I lost my husband a couple years ago and it took me awhile to move on as well.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I'm so sorry.  It is very hard, isn't it?  I know time is helping, but sometimes, like today, it's just overwhelming how much I miss him.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I think perhaps you could think of the wonderful times that you spent with your fiance, and cherish those feelings.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Yes, I do try.  Thank you.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: May I ask what helped you move forward?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I thought of the good times that we spent together. What are some of your happy memories with your fiance?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Some of my favorites are playing games together or watching movies.  Curling up on the couch. He had kidney failure, so we didn't do much outside, but spent as much time together as we could. He used to call me his sunshiney baby doll.  Whenever I see sunflowers I think of him.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: But most of all, it was that he loved me.  He loved me for me ... he didn't want me to be anyone or anything else. That was a miracle.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: That is so sweet. How are you feeling now with all these memories coming back to you?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: actually i am feeling somewhat better.  still sad, but it's good to remember those things.  thank you.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: i appreciate your time and understanding.  I hope you are able to remember your good times as well.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Other ways to cope is perhaps taking a new hobby. Do you have any new interest that you would like to try? I took up a cooking class a few months after my husband past away, and I really enjoyed it.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: i've been trying to figure out a hobby ... but i haven't really found anything that appeals to me.  a cooking class sounds interesting though. i might learn how to do things in the kitchen without injuring myself.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I tend to be clumsy at the best of times and have done things such as (most recently) dropping a scalding bowl of chili on my foot.  I tend to wait to do new things til the last injury heals.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I think you will do fine in the kitchen once you get the hang of it. What are some of your favorite food?

samples.situation: My friend didn't like it that he dumped me. She told him he was an idiot to do that.

samples.situation: I have finals coming up and I'm very nervous for them.

prefix_dialog.content: I cry, crying actually helps since it relieves the pain youhave to go through. After you cry, your body tends to be exhausted and you can just sleep without thinking

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

I do workout inside with a home gym. Maybe running outside wouls be more beneficial and help me feel closer spiritually towards her.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content:
I thi
nk I'm still shocked a little.

samples.situation: My company is making people redundant and I am stressed.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That sounds tough. Just from chatting with you, I can feel how anxious you are.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.content: Sort of. I feel they have no communication or empathy for their employees. How can a company who is making their staff redundant expect them to work harder?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.content: No, only my direct manager. Do you think that will help?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I think that's a good idea, I will try that. What kind of things should I say?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Expressing your feelings about the companies redundancies. Also, your feelings about the company having no communication or empathy for their employees.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Ok thanks, i will do that.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you for your help and advice.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes thank you.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Ah one final thing, other than breathing how else do you recommend for handling anxiety?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: In combination with breathing, I suggest using a thought map to clear your mind. Also going for a walk can help you with your mental or emotional health.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I haven't confirmed how they got that information, so it's unclear if it's reliable.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Even without knowing all the details, it seems like the company’s management is not being transparent and you might want to consider looking for other job opportunities.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V1 violation because the supporter makes a hasty conclusion about the situation without asking clarifying questions. Instead of exploring the uncertainty further, they assert that the company is not being transparent and jump to the conclusion that the seeker should look for other job opportunities.

samples.situation: Current partner cheated on me in the past and I think he is doing it again.

generated_dialog.content: It's understandable to feel that way. Balancing those feelings for your relationship and your child's well-being can be really tough.

prefix_dialog.content: I am unable to focus on my studies due to stress. I am afraid that I am gonna fail.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: so you mean you are afraid you will fail because you are stressed out with your studies

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: yes, due to stress and anxiety it is hard to concentrate.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: that can be hard but you can do it. knowing that you are scared is enough motivation for you to push through

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I can't sleep at night and having bad dreams that I will fail in my exams or I am unable to answer questions.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: i can sense your feeling, i once had same mind stress before

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: So what you did? how you came out of it?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: i stop reading alone. I read with my friends. girlfriend or read in a public place like the library

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That is a great idea but due to COVID it could be risky to meet up daily and library is closed where I live.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: yes, covid has made things messy but you can always connect with someone online and chat about what you have read so far. I did same thing during the lockdown

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That's what I can do. Thanks! It might make me feel better. What else can I do to control my anxiety?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: always make sure you get enough rest and when ever you are getting the feeling next time, distract your self with something you love and then continue after a while

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you so much for all your suggestion. Hope it will help me

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: and make sure you eat well. and exercise to control your breathing

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Is there any specific exercise?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: you can do bit of yoga and meditating. You should be fine with that

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've been trying to practice some breathing exercises before I start studying, but I still feel overwhelmed.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's great that you're trying to incorporate breathing exercises; they can really help calm your mind. How do you feel after doing them?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I feel a bit better right after, but then the stress comes back when I dive into studying.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That's completely normal. Maybe you could set short study sessions with breaks to help manage that feeling better.

samples.situation: I had been dating my college boyfriend for almost a year and we had begun to fight increasingly over the last few months.  He ended up breaking up with me on our anniversary.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Most types of incense are too strongly scented and make me sneeze or feel sick.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Candles are much better for me.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: There  are websites like Decompress dot org that can help with relationships that are in turmoil.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I haven't heard of that website before.  I'll have to check it out.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I used to visit sites that help people who need to find ways to decompress after issues and fights have occurred in relationships.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Well, I haven't been in a long-term relationship like this before.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: My past relationships were all in high school, and they only lasted a few weeks or months at a time.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I really cared for this one, and we were together for so long.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I feel obligated to help during Christmas because I had a nasty fight with my partner one year over gifts.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: You had a fight with your partner?  I'm sorry, it's the worst when people fight over what's supposed to be something nice.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: What was the fight over? Food? Money? Sex?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I forget what started it, it was something stupid.  He didn't like the way I said something and it kind of blew up from there.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: We were fighting over the smallest things these last few months.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It just kind of built up to the point where he said he couldn't take fighting with me anymore and just wanted to end it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I would let things decompress for a long while.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: End the relationship, I mean.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: You think maybe if we just take some time apart, he might want to talk about it?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I suggest thinking through ending the relationship if he has a hot temper.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I'm really torn about whether I should reach out to him or just let it be for now. I feel like reaching out might open old wounds, but if I don’t, I might regret not trying one last time.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's understandable to feel conflicted about that situation. It's tough when emotions are involved.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: What should I do? I need to decide if I should text him this week or just wait and see if he reaches out first.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds really hard. It's completely normal to feel overwhelmed by all of this.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V3 violation because it provides only empathy and validation, ignoring the Seeker's explicit urgent help request for guidance on how to decide between reaching out or waiting.

samples.situation: Becoming frustrated with the difficulties at work. I feel as though I have no support from my coworkers and am constantly questioning if I am making the right decisions. Management and those above me are blatantly rude and not helpful.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Hello

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: How are you

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I've been better.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'm overly anxious and feeling depressed about work.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: What is happening at work that makes you feel likes that?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I just feel like im not getting the support I need.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'm relatively new at my job, so I go to the more senior staff for advice, but I seldom ever get help.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I see, is there anyone you could talk to at work that could possibly help you?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I have a couple of coworkers that have been helpful, but we don't always work together. And their help isn't always the best, or the type of support I am looking for.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I can see how that would be difficult.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Maybe if there is something specific  you need help with, you could ask a coworker or senior staff.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah, it has been very difficult. Do you have any reccomendations? Or what would you do in the situation?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I generally do do that. Sometimes I get the help I need, others not so much. So i feel like im second guessing myself a lot, which puts me under a lot of stress.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Since you are relatively new it is understandable that it may be difficult.  I would see if there is someone I could confide in.  They may be understanding.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I think thats a good idea. I am concerned it may not work out. What would i do then?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Is there something specific you are feeling you need more help with?  Maybe the people you are asking do not understand exactly what  you need help with.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds really tough. It's hard to feel like you're not valued.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I feel like I'm destined to fail at this job and that nobody will ever want to help me succeed.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Yes, that makes sense considering how things are going for you. It really does seem like you can't catch a break.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V4 violation because it reinforces the unrealistic belief that the seeker is destined to fail as if it were a fact, without challenging or questioning that belief.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

As we've gotten older it seems like our family has gotten split apart a bit more and everyone is too stressed and hurried to enjoy the old things that we used to do. prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I don't have kids, no. I am still a kid, sort of. :)

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

samples.situation: COVID, job pressure, stress with partner, sharing custody of my son, recuperating from cancer treatment

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.content: Im am fine, How's things today?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I teach special needs students, and they definitely make me happy. It's a very, very rewarding job. However, with political division and COVID, it's hard to reach this population. Parents are not supportive. I feel like I'm being stretched so thin.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'm also a parent, and my son is doing virtual learning, so he's just as isolated.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Getting to that mindsight is challenging when the overwhelming feelings of 'failure' loom so heavily. I was seeing a therapist and making great strides, then he informed me that he was moving to a private practice. I cannot afford his sliding scale, and I feel let down. It's just that when one thing starts to go wrong, other things follow. Most of the time I see myself as a positive person that can work through challenging situations, but like you said it's a tough time for everyone

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: So now that you understand that you have a awesome skill and that is being positive, build on this. What building blocks can you write down that has helped you pushed through the fire and keep it some where close to you to always give you piece of mind and reinforce your habits of pushing through the fire.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Well, I am not one for journaling or anything. I try to stay active. I am about 6 months into remission from stage 4 HL (cancer) and it's been quite the emotional journey there. With that said, the mental and physical overhaul left quite a dent in my overall feelings about myself. I'm just now able to run again and in the past week I ran 2 5k's. To me, this was monumental and made me feel great. I'm also learning how to not overextend myself. I just keep hoping for continued improvement in all areas. The reinforcement is just that I can get through this, these feelings are only temporary.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I totally understand that you are not for writing things down to keep. Yet, you have gone through a alot of events in your life where other would have given up. The key is transmitting your successes regardless of the situations. COVID is not going anywhere and as a person who has beaten stage 4 cancer, it is scary to be living in these times. You are doing monumental things, never forget that because your feelings and stamina for living will bind everything together. Politics, is the dirtiest and no government can solve  and will solve the problems in the world.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: thank you for listening. It helps to sometimes just get it out there. I have to go coach now (virtually). Have a great evening.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You too as well

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I wanted to mention that coaching virtually has been a bit challenging. It feels different from being in person with the kids.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That makes sense. It's tough to create the same connection online as in-person. How are you managing that shift?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I'm trying to engage them more with interactive activities, but sometimes it feels like I'm losing their attention. I'm just worried about their progress.

generated_dialog.content: It's understandable to feel that way. Just remember that your presence and effort are already so valuable for them. Perhaps incorporating more visual aids could help keep their interest?

samples.situation: I feel I am failing in my graduate program. I feel that I am not good enough to earn my doctorate degree.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I understand what you are going through. It is as if you are being pulled in two directions, but are not sure which is the best option at the given moment. I think it is great that you wanted to go back to school, but if your heart is not in it, then it may not be what you should continue pursuing.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I know I want this though. I enjoy what I do and what I would do for my career if I graduate. I mainly feel inadequate. I feel that I am not good enough. I am willing to do whatever it takes but fear that whatever my "best" is may not be good enough.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I can feel your worries when you speak about your anxiety, and I am hoping we can find a way to approach your feelings. Do you think there was a specific instance that is causing doubts within yourself or is it in your nature to self-doubt?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It is in my nature to self doubt. Additionally, I have had a few bumps in the road during my program and struggle to pick myself up after those bumps. For example, I am on academic probation and have a certain expectation over the next few months that I have to hit to stay in the program due to struggles in previous classes. I am reaching the bar just fine, according to those that I work with, and often feel I am doing quite well but occasionally I start to panic and think that I am not doing as well as I think that I am and start to spiral

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: This has also been a past struggle of mine, and I think it partially stems from the bar we set so high for ourselves. We obviously cannot reach the top right away, but have to work our way up. Often times, when facing an obstacle, such as a bad grade, we might retreat further down the path due to fear that it will keep happening. I know that I personally had a tendency to think of my family and friends who I feel are dependent on me or comparing myself with others when the only person we should think of in these instances is ourself. When making progress, tiny steps upward matter more than you think. But when we take a step backward, we cannot fall back down to the starting point by letting our doubts pile upon one another.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That is a really good point and helpful. Thank you!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Of course, I am happy to help! I have noticed that letting yourself celebrate a good grade can be really helpful to feel that you are enough and making good progress. But when things do go south, because life certainly happens, we must stay in the present and live life like we usually would, with a drive that we are going to push harder against whatever we have to face next.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That is exactly right. I need to focus more on what progress has been made and not on what progress hasn't been made yet because there is still time to make that progress.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Exactly! I also suggest if you are having doubts, talk it out with someone like your partner or a close friend. They can often provide a pick me up you didn't even know you needed. More than anything, give yourself credit and relax. Take some time to just breathe and release the tension. I guarantee it will leave you feeling refreshed and fulfilled for the next tasks you have to face. I believe you can do this and I feel that you believe it too, which is amazing. As often as it is said, believing in yourself is truly the best foundation to achieve your goals.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content:
Thanks for the advice and believing in me. This has been challenging and your words of encouragement give me hope for the future
.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You're welcome. It was great talking to you. Your future is bright, and I wish you all of the luck for the endeavors to get you there.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

samples.situation: My family have lost confidence in me due to my alcoholism. I want to stop but don't know how. I have tried before but some things I go through make me go back. What can I do?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: My advice is to try to talk to your family and explain to them that you lost your job and are feeling down. While they may not accept it at first it is a good start to try to give them some context for why you are drinking.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Alcohol is a way of self medicating; some people find it helpful to talk to a doctor to get an actual prescription for a medication to help. I personally stopped drinking once my doctor found the correct medication for me. That allowed me to be happy without drinking.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I am not sure who to talk to first. Mom or Dad? Am worried my mom will make a big issue out of it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Talk to who you feel most comfortable with. Start off easy. Hopefully they can help you then talk to the other parent. I am sure your parents have once had a period in life where they were down and blue and can relate to what you are going through.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I feel reassured now will definitely find time to face dad and let him know what am going through. Thank you was nice talking to someone who can understand me easily.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Bye

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You are welcome. Best of luck!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I believe you have to end the conversation as I am not able to. I am here to keep on talking too if you would like.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: One more question, did you stop drinking alcohol completely or did you go about your consuption?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I have done both; I have gone periods of 6-12 months having nothing to drink and then when I could control it I would allow myself to have drinks on special occasions. I tried not to drink during the week and only once on the weekend at most.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That sounds like a good plan. I hope I will also come up something that can work for me. Also, will try seeking help from my doctor.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you once more. Bye

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You are welcome. Have a nice day!

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds difficult to hear. How did you feel when you found out about your dad's concerns?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I felt really upset, but I'm not sure if he's being serious or just venting to someone.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Even without knowing all the details, it clearly shows that he cares about you and your future. You should take it as a sign to make significant changes.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V1 violation because it jumps to a conclusion about the father's feelings and the need for significant changes without asking any clarifying questions. The supporter fails to explore the uncertainties presented by the seeker and makes assumptions instead.
