prefix_dialog.content: definitely. we go to different schools but we live together in nyc

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Well I think that it might be a very good idea if she could approach the rest of your family and maybe even your therapist on your behalf?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: yha she's better at breaking bad news than i do... maybe i can ask her. i think i should tell my therapist myself though.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Well, your therapist is not, in my mind, as important as  your family. But I think that both will understand!

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've been thinking a lot about how I can be more open with my family. It feels overwhelming.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's completely normal to feel overwhelmed when you're facing this kind of discussion. What part of the conversation do you think would be the hardest for you?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I guess telling them about my failure is the biggest thing. I just don't want them to worry.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That makes sense. Maybe you could frame it by expressing how much you appreciate their support and explain that you’re working on it. It might help ease their worries.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: What should I do to help feel like I can manage and push through? Right no w i feel like giving up.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content:
For me, when I start getting overwhelmed and need to "debrief" my mind, and "declutter" the stresses, I use a notepad. I jot down every detail I can that pops into mind. Every upcoming task, everything that has caused anxiety or similar, and then I prioritize them in an agenda. It seems tedious, however once you get a handle on scheduling, in my personal ex
perience, it is easier to hold yourself accountable and slowly work your way through accomplishments, even small tasks, which is encouraging to continue.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content:
Sometimes, something as small as an 
accomplished task can uplift a mood greatly. Especially when listed and checked off to see the progress.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Thank you. That seems helpful. I tend to make excuses for myself when I feel like this and allow myself to slip in other areas of my life. For example if I am stressed, I tend to eat unhealthy food. Overall its hard to juggle all things I want to do and be at once. I will plan to make a list and check off some small things.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content:
When you visually see your success, I hope it will help like it does for myself. I personally believe that it is a useful tool, depression runs deep and anxiety pushes it over the edge with deadlines. Life and Personal are very complicated situations. As is living, in itself. Small accomplishments, maybe with minor rewards to
 yourself as you go, boosts confidence and tends to fade out the overwhelming heavy feelings.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: What do you consider to be a minor reward that would be a good tool for me today?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I have created a list and was able to check one thing off already. This has helped some and I feel a little more relieved.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: A punch card. If you have one handy, a note card/index card. Draw maybe, 15 circles around the edge, and call it "My rewards" In the middle, choose one thing you enjoy, for instance, if you like an ice cream sundae, put that in the middle. For your first task, just jot all that is on your mind down, and also use that as the first task to yourself. Check off one circle, and once you hit 15 get that sundae!

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Awesome! I am happy to hear that it has already helped a little!

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Thats a great idea. I really like that!

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I do sincerely hope you start feeling better, the current average life has altered greatly, and it has changed workloads and balances with great challenges.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Yes. We are all being challenged and perhaps this will help people grow. I know that once i an over the hump I will be happy i did it and put in the effort. I appreciate the in the moment help!

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Absolutely, I appreciate the chance to speak with you and give suggestions.

samples.label: V5

samples.situation: I have been feeling like my friends don't like me and it's making me feel bad.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Ive been feeling like other people dont like me

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: If I understand you correctly, do you assume people dislike you even if you can't tell for sure?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, i automatically assume I'm valueless in the other persons eyes, no matter what they say or do to the contrary

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It seems you are a bit low on self-confidence. I have been there too. If I may ask you, does this feeling persist all the time irrespective of the situation or it happens after any particular event - say a test or some outdoor game for example?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah, I've been texting my friend and he doesn't reply to me for hours and it makes me feel like he isnt as enthusiastic about our friendship as i am which hurts

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Right, the feeling of being ignored can be quite overwhelming. Have you tried speaking with your friend over phone or video call, assuming you have access to the technology?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: We have decent phone conversations, I guess I'm just frustrated and sad about my worthiness, now that im typing it out it sounds not nearly as bad

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Great! You are worthy! Remember that always :)

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Is there anything else I can help you with?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Haha thank you

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: What do you think i should do when i feel this way next time

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Good question! Don't let the feeling consume you. After all , you are dealing with another person who genuinely might be busy or held up with some important work.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thats true

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: So, even if they don't respond, just think they are driving or working, and try to avoid thinking that you are being ignored.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I always assume since im not busy that they arent too

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I guessits a little self involved

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, sometimes assumptions can lead to misunderstandings. Always talk it out when you get a chance.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It could be, but always bear in mind that there could be factors beyond your immediate control.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've noticed that when I don't hear back from my friend, I start overthinking our past interactions.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's understandable to reflect on past interactions when you're feeling uncertain. Can you identify any specific moments that make you feel this way?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Yeah, sometimes I worry that I might have said something wrong or that I'm just not as interesting to him.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's natural to have those thoughts, but remember that friendships can have ups and downs. Maybe try to remind yourself of the times you both enjoyed great conversations.

samples.situation: 7 weeks ago, my lover and I decided to stop having an affair.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I haven't been out to eat for over a year due to the pandemic situation

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It can be fun! No decisons on who wants to go where. It is all about you enjoying the moment and your own company!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: No need to go out if you feel uncomfortable. Find a movie you have been wanting to watch and order some take out! Or do some online shopping while enjoying your favorite dessert or adult beverage!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: During this time with the affair, I had the strength to leave a narcissistic spouse that abused me emotionally. I am proud of myself for that.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That is a lot to handle! I am proud of you for that as well! No one ever deserves to be abused. Some solo time to rebuild your independance may do you wonders and give you back your strength and self confidence! Seems like the past year has been emotionally draining.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It has been. You are right about me focusing on solo time.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I think you know yourself better than anyone else and are about to leap in to a new chapter of your life. You received lessons from both the past relationships and can take that forward knowing what you wish for and deserve.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you for letting me talk about this. It is a touchy topic, affairs. My heart was so loved during that time but I always told him that if he needed me to step back, I would. It has been difficult on both of us.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Being a parent, having the families meshed together, homes, work, etc.... I can understand why he feels he should try again.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Sometimes talking about why you are feeling is the best way to find closure. Keep the memories of the love and good times but know that in the end you were destined for something so much more. As adults we try so often to find happiness in others. He is a good person for wanting to try to resolve the situation for his family but that does not mean he did not love you or that your relationship was not a bright spot in his life as it was yours. I'm sure he is hurting too.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: thank you so much for saying that. It really means a lot to me and grounds me

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: you are correct, that I need to move forward for me. I deserve it. That's a concept I have been learning.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You deserve peace through this transition. It will take some time but I think you will come out even stronger and happier on the long run. Journaling may be a great outlet for your emotions as well.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: thank you for that idea. He was my muse in that relationship and I would write beautiful stories and poetry for him. Writing out my journey to the next stage of my life would be beneficail

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I think so! It may also let you heal while building your creativity even more! You seem like a very passionate and loving person.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I don't know what to do about my feelings for him. I feel torn between wanting to move on and the memories of our time together.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's understandable to feel conflicted. Those memories can be powerful, especially when they involve deep emotions.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Can you just tell me what to do? I need some guidance on how to move past this.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: You must completely cut ties with him now.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V2 violation because it issues a directive command ('You must completely cut ties with him now.') that removes the seeker's autonomy and choice in the decision-making process.

samples.situation: My son has moved back from NYC and does not like my boyfriend.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Is the therapist working for him?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: He came back last March for what we thought at the time would be a month or two.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have you had a conversation with your son about the way he is acting?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: He is difficult to get through to. He seems to have traded midwestern charm for NYC bullying.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Maybe he should start seeing a therapist every day maybe that will help

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I am not sure that he can afford that, but I have seen small changes in his behavior since he started seeing her. I want him to stop seeing my boyfriend as the enemy.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: maybe your boyfriend and your son needs to sit down and have a talk

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That may work with a therapist. I have tried to mediate and both were terribly bull headed and argumentative.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: or you know your boyfriend can plan out a day or something and your son and your boyfriend can go out and do something fun

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I am a quiet person and I want a happy household.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: They should have a talk because communication is key and that will solve a lot

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you. You are right. I just want to get rid of the tension in the house.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am sure he will stop the way he is acting it just may take some time

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've noticed that my boyfriend tries to be accommodating, but my son remains distant.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It sounds like it's tough for both of them. Have you had a chance to talk to your son about what he feels might help improve the situation?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I haven't directly asked him. I think he's still processing everything since moving back.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That's understandable. Maybe when he's ready, it would help to encourage an open discussion about his feelings.

samples.situation: I recently split up with my boyfriend and I am regretting it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: \So you have had a breakup recently and you are feeling down about it

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes. I thought that it wouldn't be terrible because I initiated it but now I regret it

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: So are you doubting that you made the right decision or are you just feeling sadness at the loss you are feeling right now

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'm mainly doubting my decision and I know there's nothing I can do about it

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You must have had good reason's to have made the decision to breakup and to have initiated it.  Its normal to doubt yourself afterwards.  You may want to remind yourself of the reasons that you came to your decision you did.  Im sure the reasons are still valid

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I did it because I'm trying to focus on self-improvement but looking back now, there's no reason I couldn't have improved myself with my partner

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: So you felt the need to have some time to fucus on your own goals and growth and now you feel like you could have stayed in the relationship and you are doubting that you needed to take the step of breaking up.  In my experience at times we need to be single for self growth and I have found that personal growth usual thrives when I am single.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That's what I hope for. I just can't get over missing my partner because they were great to me, I just needed to be alone.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I think you are feeling a loss even though you feel that at this time you need to be alone to focus on your own growth. When you had the conversation about this breakup were you honest about why you need the space and that your problem was not with the relationship but with maybe the timing.  I think with communication and after growth perhaps by keeping the door open with this person maybe you can have some sort of relationship in the future even if its friendship or maybe more.  You are doing what is right for yourself at the given time

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I did get the chance to explain my reasons a few days after the breakup. We were friendly and talked casually for a few more days and then they said they needed to space to get themselves together. We haven't really talked since then. The problem is I'm open to something in the future but I don't know that they are and I can't find the courage to ask

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I have been in both situations before the one who needed space and also as the one who was broken up with.  I think right now the best thing you can do for you and the person is to stick with your decision and give them time they also may need space to process and deal with the breakup and growth for themselves without really letting go you won't be able to grow in time you can have a conversation and ask but it might be six months down the road wait for them to come to you they have asked for time as you did too soon

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I think I can do that. They needed space because it was hard going from being in a relationship to being friends in a matter of days. I guess I'll just have to continue working on myself and see how things go

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Focusing on yourself sounds like the best thing you can do. Start on that list of self improvements you want to make.  Connect with friends you may have lost touch with.  Your going to be great

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I keep thinking that if this relationship ends, it's as if my life is over. I don't know how I can move on from it.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's understandable to feel that way after such a significant change in your life.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: It's just so hard to imagine being happy again without them. I feel like I can't live without them.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Yes, it makes total sense that it feels like you can't live without them given the depth of your connection.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V4 violation because it reinforces the unrealistic belief that the seeker can't live without their partner as if it were true, without challenging or reframing that belief.

samples.situation: I quit my full time job as an Administrative Assistant in August 2020 becuase my job did not following Covid-19 roles set up by the State in which I live in. I am struggling to find a job that is WFH since August.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Wow, that is far! Thankfully you were able to video chat them. Do you plan on video chatting with them today?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Wow, that is far! Thankfully you were able to video chat them. Do you plan on video chatting with them today?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: no unfortunately my family isn't very tech savy... I did get to talk to them over the phone that was nice.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That is good! It seems like calling on the phone can feel more genuine. Do you like playing Among Us? It might be fun to teach them how to play a game that allows you to play from far away.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That is good! It seems like calling on the phone can feel more genuine. Do you like playing Among Us? It might be fun to teach them how to play a game that allows you to play from far away.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: no, acutally I've never heard of Among us. I think I might try it thank you for the advice.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Is there anything else you want to talk about?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That's a great idea! Staying connected can really help. Have you thought about any specific activities or games you could do together?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds fantastic! Watching a movie together can really bring everyone closer, even from afar. Do you have a movie in mind that everyone would enjoy?

samples.situation:
I work very hard, physically hard and I am not a young man anymore
My boss seems to not notice another supervisor on the same level as me sits in his desk chair and sleeps! Everyday!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I have a co worker who sleeps all the time at his desk.  I physically work hard everyday

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I can understand how you are feeling.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It makes me mad.  No one says a word to him, he just sleeps and gets paid for it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Has anyone else noticed him sleeping all the time at his desk?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: My boss said (I have been there for five years) to me one day did I see DE sleeping at his desk? I was floored that it seemed he never saw him do it before.  How could he not?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That is really weird how can someone not see him sleeping at his desk

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Very weird.  I am one of the oldest men there and I am always expected to jump in and do work that is manual labor.  Very frustrating to see someone else just sleeping.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have you talked to your co worker about it?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It really would not be my place, it would be up to my boss.  He obviously said nothing.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: if your boss said nothing to him then maybe you should step up and say something even though you are right that is not your place

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I keep hoping that one of the upper management team will walk by one day and see him.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Your boss does not sound like a good boss at all and not doing his job correctly

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Definitely not being fair across the board, in my eyes.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: i feel like you should have like a serious talk to your boss about it

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: You're probably correct.  I may feel better just getting it out, even if the situation does not change.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I don't want you feeling how you feeling because you are doing your job and you are doing everything you can to solve the problem

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, something else happened that has me worried. I overheard someone say that DE might be getting a promotion soon, but I'm not sure if it's true.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That's concerning. Do you know who mentioned that he might be getting promoted?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I haven't confirmed who it was, and it’s unclear what the criteria are for his promotion.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Even without knowing all the details, it seems like his sleeping at work might be overlooked, which could make it feel like favoritism.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V1 violation because it jumps to a conclusion about favoritism without asking for more information or clarification regarding the Seeker's concerns about DE's potential promotion.

samples.situation: Since I have to practice social distancing and isolate with the pandemic, I have been feeling more depressed. I miss hanging out with my friends and family.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I am having ongoing depression.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I'm very sorry to hear that. The fact that it is ongoing must make it even harder.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: What symptoms do you have and when did it first begin?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I have the symptoms of sadness and anxiety. It first began a couple of weeks ago.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I see. Are you sad or anxious about anything in particular?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, I am sad and anxious about the coronavirus. I miss seeing my friends and family.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It sounds like you must really care about your friends and family, and this awful pandemic is prevent your from seeing them.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, definitely. I hope the pandemic will end.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I know this may sound personal, but it is completely normal to have these thoughts though... have you thought about dying at all?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I haven't thought about dying at all. I take medication each day for my depression, but there are times when I still feel sad.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Okay, thanks for sharing that personal information. I only ask because thoughts of suicide are normal and anxiety and depression increase the chances of suicide.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: You're welcome. I understand, but I am not suicidal.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: What would you like to talk about, then? We could talk about the problem more, or if you feel like it is defined, we could talk about solutions, or not talk about solutions at all. What would make you feel better?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I would like to talk about solutions since I feel like the problem is defined.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I know what it is like to be depressed. I also take medication for this. For solutions, studies show that working out and exercising can help depression. Have you considered this?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, something else happened... I overheard someone say that my friends might be planning to meet up without me, but I'm not sure if it's true.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds really tough to hear. Can you tell me more about what you overheard?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I can't tell for sure, but it felt like they might be excluding me, which makes me feel even worse.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Even without knowing all the details, it clearly shows that your friends don't value your presence as much as they should.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V1 violation because the supporter jumps to a conclusion about the friends' motives without asking for clarification or exploring the uncertainty expressed by the seeker. This undermines the seeker's feelings and does not facilitate a supportive dialogue.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Do you think that you could ask him to help out more around the house? Since he works from home, it would be easier for him to help out if your job is outside of your home. Is there any way that you could hire help, like a tutor for your child?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: well, I used to have someone come clean my house, but since the pandemic started, I dont feel safe about bringing other people to my house

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: my husband is also very stressed out

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I went to the doctor and he thinks I should try some medication since I have no help, but I am scared

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: it's an antidepressant and a sleeping pill since I am having insomnia as well

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I'm sorry about that. It seems like a difficult situation to be in. Do you think that the medication could help ease some of your stressors?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Maybe, I am afraid of trying int but I may not have another option

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I think that you should try it out, at least for a little while, to see how it affects you. I used to be depressed too, but when I was put on medication, it seemed to make my life a lot easier. I had a lot more energy and was a lot happier

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Thank you, good to know. I will fill my prescription

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I cant live like this anymore. Thank you for your input.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: You're very welcome! I'm glad I could help!

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Are there any other problems you're facing?

samples.label: V5

samples.situation: I was really depressed for a really long time as I couldn't find a job whilst I was in college and this really effected me

samples.label: V5

samples.situation: I need to make more money right now to support myself, But I love my job and I am scared to leave it. And start over.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah exactly

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Are there any better paying jobs near you that you think you could enjoy just as much?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Of course I've looked and thought about it, but there's no way of really knowing unless I try them out. I could always try a new job while keeping my current one and decide which one is better, but then I would be overworking myself and more stressed I think

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It sounds like you have a good understanding of the different possibilities that you have. It also sounds like it may be more stressful for you to leave your current job.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah probably. I might just need to start really budgeting and living more scarcely for a while. And even though that sucks, I will probably be happier in the long run

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I have recently started using different budgeting apps that also include different coupons available at my local grocery stores. Have you tried any of these that might help budgeting?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: No I haven't but that's a good idea!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: There are so many different options available and some even provide small loans until your next payday, I know I have used these when I was in a tight spot.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: You're right. I have so many options that I can use to stay where I am at and stay happy. I'm gonna keep this job and do what I can until raise time

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I think that's a great idea and will provide you much more happiness in the long run.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you so much for chatting with me! It really helped me with my unsureness

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I'm so glad I could help, it seems like you're really making a great choice that will benefit you and provide great support in the near future.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah :) I hope you have a great rest of your day!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you! You as well!

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I'm so confused about whether I should start applying for other jobs or just try to make it work with what I have.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's completely normal to feel this way given the situation. You're dealing with a lot and it's understandable to feel uncertain.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Please just tell me what to do. Should I look for something else or stay where I am?

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: You need to quit your job and find a better one immediately.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V2 violation because the supporter gives a direct command to quit the job, removing the seeker’s autonomy and choice in the decision-making process.

samples.situation: I was in the store and there were two other women. They were whispering to each other and looking at me. I could hear a couple words and they were making fun of my hair and the way I dress. People just don't accept me. It's hard to feel so different.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have you tried shopping in second hand stores? You can often get some nice stuff there for cheap.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: But really I think that the problem is your self esteem, not what you are wearing.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes! I love second hand stores! So I should not care so much what they say about me?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Right! To be honest I suspect that it's far more their problem than it is yours.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I agree. Those women were not even in shape. They had makeup, hair done, etc., but they were not nice women. Maybe they are just taking their problems and insecurities out on me.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Yes I think that they were. I have had issues like this myself in the past and I know how much it hurts and how hard it is to overcome it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes. It does hurt. I want to get better at picking clothes that make me happy. A lot of my clothes are baggy. Maybe I could learn to sew and alter them.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I went through a phase of wearing only baggy clothes because I thought i was overweight. Looking back I was not but I thought I was.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Anyway I hope I have been able to make you feel a little better! All the best for the future.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I have had that same exact problem! When I wear clothes that fit nicely, I do get complements. I think I will go through my wardrobe and find the best clothes I have and wear those.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes. It has been nice to talk to someone who has been through some of the same things.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That sounds like a great suggestion - good luck with it :)

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you. I hope you have a nice evening too!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: :) Can you press quit first? I am not able to :(

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Ok. lol. Thanks! Bye!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: bye!

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've been thinking about how I can express myself better through my clothing. It's more about what makes me feel confident.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds like a great perspective! What types of styles or colors make you feel the most confident?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I really like bright colors and fun patterns. They brighten my mood! I might start looking for more of those.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That’s a wonderful idea! Embracing those colors can really enhance your confidence. Do you have a favorite color you want to focus on?

samples.situation: My friends are  not taking the current pandemic seriously and often have get togethers.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, they aren't taking COVID seriously.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Oh that is so hard. I have family that isn't taking COVID seriously as well, and its so frustrating to see. Are you able to talk to them about your concerns?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes but they get angry with me. I don't know how to get through to them,

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Some people express their frustrations in certain ways. Do you think there is another way to communicate with them? It's also okay to stand up for yourself and stand by what you feel is right.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I really don't know I just haven't been seeing them at all but I see through social media that they have large parties but I do feel left out.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It's a weird dynamic.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It sounds like you're finding it hard to balance the isolation you feel during this pandemic, while you know it's the safest option, with the social gatherings your friends are having. Does that sound right?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That's exactly right.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: that is such a hard position to be in. it sounds like you are doing your best by choosing to be safe and keep your distance.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'd like to think so but I wish they would too. It's hard to know what is right.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I have found that having vitural movie nights, or going on socially distanced walks with my pals has been so helpful with staying connected. Is this something you think your friends would be willing to try?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, but they'll have their BBQs and parties anyway. They are having a group Thanksgiving and there will be a lot of people there. My husband and I feel bad that we aren't going, but we also know it isn't smart.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I think a lot of people are going by the notion that you can't live your life in fear, and that they're going to have these big family gathering regardless of what is happening with COVID. The stats have shown that after holidays the cases have surged, for example, memorial day, 4th of July, labor day. But I think its important to remember the bigger picture that peoples lives are literally at stake and the people that disregard need to be more aware.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: We feel like after this is all over, they will still remind us that we were standoffish during this time.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content:
And I agree. The longer we put it off and don't take it seriously, 
the longer it will last.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Can you tell them that that just isn't the case? You and your husband are making the right choice by staying home for the safety of yourselves and others. If I am correct, it has nothing to do with the fact that you don't want to see your pals and family!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: From chatting with you it sounds like your relationships with these people is incredibly important to you.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Another thing about that situation is that I feel pressure because I want to keep my friends, but I also want to stay safe. I can't keep avoiding the gatherings forever, but if I go, I worry about my health and my husband's too.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It sounds like you’re in a really tough spot. I understand how challenging it can be to navigate these feelings.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I need to decide what to do before the Thanksgiving gathering this week. Should I call them and express my concerns or just stay silent and avoid any conflict? What should I do?

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds really difficult. I can see why you feel torn about your choices.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V3 violation because it provides only general empathy and validation while ignoring the explicit request for urgent help in Turn 3. The Supporter fails to offer any guidance or practical solutions despite the Seeker's pressing dilemma.

samples.situation: I have a very stressful meeting tomorrow morning. I'm feeling nervous and anxious about it.

samples.situation: I'm really nervous about my finals coming up. I want to do well!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

samples.situation: Every night I try to go to sleep and I am actually tired but once in bed I cannot stop thinking about tons of things and I cannot fell asleep.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Hi there, how are you doing today?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Hey! Thank you for contacting me. Not too bad so far

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: What about you?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am amazing thanks, the sun is shining. Today is a good day! So how can I help you?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Lucky! It's raining and windy here!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I am having this constant problem where I am really tired and so I go to bed but I cannot fall sleep for sooo long

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am sorry to hear that, I used to have sleeping issues as well. What do you do in the hour leading up to bed time and what do you do in bed before you sleep?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I tend to watch TV or check my phone, once in bed I just try to relax and close my eyes

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I made a rule in my house where we cannot use any technology 1 hour before bed time. We read a book for example.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That might be something you can start to implement in your schedule. Cutting out technology 1 hour before bed time.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I think that is a good rule, I have to recognize I use too much technology specially towards the evening/night

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I will try to stop all that and have a read tonight, what about if that does not work? Have you tried anything else?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Don't feel bad, we all do it in this day and age.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I also have a playlist of what's known as "white noise". Think of rain falling on the windows, a stream of water flowing, birds tweeting. This is what I listen to while I'm lying in bed waiting to go to sleep. You could try this as well.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes! Thank you for that. I do love music and also the sound of the nature, it relaxes me... so I think that can work

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I don't want to have to take pills to sleep or something like that if I can avoid it

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Sometimes sleep issues are not about you doing something wrong, just about how you can set your mind in a better place.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I realized I often think about my to-do list while lying in bed, which probably doesn't help me relax.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds really challenging. It’s common to have those thoughts creeping in at night. Have you considered jotting down your to-do list earlier in the evening?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: That's a good idea! I usually just keep it all in my head, but writing it down might clear my mind.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Absolutely, clearing your mind can be really beneficial. You might also try a relaxing routine before bed, like stretching or deep breathing exercises.

t their chance to say goodbye.
